>I'll third this comment.
>
>Alan is a top notch dj, producer, artist, and overall great guy.
>
>We had Alan come out to the first ever trust outdoor event in Wisconsin in
>1994.  Due to some complications with our choice of speakers, and the
>nighbor 4 miles away complaining about their walls viberating, we had to
>drop the volume significantly to keep the event going.
>
>Luckily Alan ramped up the energy even with the stacks at 1/4 volume, and
>everyone went away happy.
>
>Looking forward to seeing/hearing him again.

AndyW wrote:

>On Mon, 14 Jul 2003 kdb@technolounge.org wrote:~
>-&e->
>-&e->DJ T-1000..   D-Jax, Pure Sonik, Tresor
>-&e->
>-&e->One of the forefathers of Detroit's techno scene his 1987 debut on
>-&e->the "Fast Forward" radio program fueled the fledgling Detroit techno
>-&e->scene. His pure minimal techno sound has won him international
>-&e->acclaim and a place in Detroit's Historical Museum Exhibit, Techno:
>-&e->Detroit's Gift to the World. We are very fortunate to have this
>-&e->legend ignite our decks for you.
>
>You forgot to mention that he's way more than just a DJ/producer.
>
>Most of the comic book stuff here is his work:
>http://www.djax.nl/
>http://www.capsite.net/grafix/aoldham/aoldham.htm
>
>Anyway, along with US label UR (undergroundresistance, detroit... who
>brought a super minimal criminal activist vibe), t-1000 aka alan oldham
>has brought a lot of techno's most creative visual imagery and concepts to
>the world (countless comic style stuff for djax, the logo designs for
>transmat and kms, list goes on).  AND he fuckin shreds as a dancefloor DJ,
>producer of some of the genres banginest tracks and historically as a
>radio DJ with a show going back to 1987.
>
>Take this opportunity to see the man throw down.  Essential listening for
>anybody interested in techno...
>
>andyw

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Club Six and Doc Martin

--0-448442706-1058279964=:14429
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Right on....that was an awesome party...great vibe...great people.

Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:As many of you may know, Leslie Ayres, former moderator of this list and 
SFLNC activist, is back from Thailand -- permanently, this time. So Joey 
and I took her out for a night of dancing at Club 6 last Saturday.

I pretty much tend to avoid clubs these days. I've come to detest security 
pat downs and surveillance so I keep most of my dancing in the friendly 
underground -- with the exception of Club 6.

Club 6 is to my mind the closest thing to an underground party "above" 
ground. The venue has the feel of a warehouse downstairs, sweat and 
all. And we sweated Saturday night. The place was packed for the Doc's 
4-hour set and we danced almost continuously. When a DJ has four hours on 
the tables he/she can really reveal the musical soul, and Doc Martin's set 
was amazingly eclectic and beautifully complex. He threw down some of his 
remixes, moved to banging, rockin' house, then there was some very trippy 
acid stuff, and even some soulful, disco-flavored house. Reminded me of 
those early parties when Doc was based in San Francisco.

When we left around four we all looked like we had been in a torrential 
downpour -- just soaking wet. And I noticed my pants were covered in 
dirt. What one used to call raver dirt. So satisfying, it was. Down and 
dirty at Club 6. Props to the owner of that venue -- hope they can 
maintain the freedom and the vibe.

They could, however, purchase a few more fans:)

Love,

Apollo

Moksha Tribe: www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101: http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It's 
a relationship between equals. Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others. Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Prop S Meeting in SF

--=====================_16589123==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

The Drug Policy Alliance, in coordination with Assemblyman Mark Leno, the 
San Francisco Medical Society, the San Francisco Medical Cannabis Task 
Force, Americans for Safe Access, California NORML, and Marijuana Policy 
Project, invite you to a:


COMMUNITY FORUM ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROPOSITION S:
SAN FRANCISCO'S COMMITMENT TO MEDICAL MARIJUANA


WHEN:   Tuesday, July 22, 2003, 9:30 am to 3:00 pm
WHERE:  First Unitarian Church, 1187 Franklin Street (at Geary)
INFO:   PLEASE R.S.V.P. by contacting: Ellie Schafer,
         EllieSchafer@msn.com, 415.584.7675
         Open to the Public
         Breakfast and Lunch provided


As we move forward with the Implementation of Proposition S, we need your 
input and participation!


San Francisco has supported Medical Marijuana for over 25 years.  In 2002, 
62% of San Francisco's voters passed Proposition S, which calls for the 
City and County of San Francisco to explore the possibility of cultivating 
and distributing Medical Marijuana.


We are proud to host a Community Forum during which we will introduce and 
discuss various implementation plans, as well as hear from experts in the 
field of medical marijuana.


We want to hear your ideas and concerns. Our goal is to include, inform, 
and unite our community as we proceed with this groundbreaking legislation.


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no

adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."

Subject: [sfraves] nrr: software?

hey i was wondering what kind of software you folks out there 
would recommend for mixing.  i have a friend who's just learning 
and they asked for suggestions, but i've only ever worked from a 
composition oriented stand point.  maybe this is a really dumb 
question.  anyway, i know that a lot of the software i've used for 
electronic compositions could also be used for just mixing, but 
they might be a little bit overkill.  and i can't imagine that 
features like, oh, being able to view/edit everything as standard 
staff notation is really helpful. 

thanks!

Coming July 26th, 2003
*~Stilldream 3 Year Anniversary Campout~*
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------

22 hours of camping and continuous music in a beautiful
outdoor setting, featuring the best of techno, trance, and house from cali
and beyond:



DJ T-1000 (pure sonik records, tresor, d-jax beats, detroit)
The master of Disaster, Alan Oldham aka T-1000 coming straight from Detroit
to bring you some of that bangin techno sound, this is going to be one of
the most talked about sets of the year. Make sure you don't miss it!

Brad and Treavor (moontribe, l.a.)
DJ Brad's eclectic mixes flow smoothly, taking the listener on a musical
journey where time and space seem to disappear. Using the language of music
to unite and celebrate the earth and humanity is Brad's goal.

While most DJs are focused on one type of electronica, Treavor is known to
make the barriers between Techno, Trance, House and Breaks seem non-existent
often fusing them into one set. Be ready for the "DJ Treavor experience"!

John Massey (soundRehab, l.a.)
Deffinatly one of the hardest dj's coming out of the SoCal area in the
recent years, prepare to have this peerless pioneer of the classic and
contemporary techno sound use a rich blend of some bangin beats intermeshed
with drummy tracks yielding enough energy to run the lights in Los Angeles.

Praxis (LIVE PA, omniscient records, s.f.)

reported crop circles in the US. So did anyone else on the list go check this 
out? I did, I find it strange because my girlfriend and I thought we saw UFO's 
in that same area on our way to Reno on 3th of July. We didn't take it too 
seriously because we only saw a glipse but this story makes it quite a 
coincidence.

From sfraves-return-103867-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed Jul 16 07:44:32 2003

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 18321 invoked from network); 16 Jul 2003 07:44:31 -0000
From: JBlaze112@aol.com
Message-ID: <136.21f4022d.2c465c55@aol.com>
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2003 03:44:21 EDT
To: johnv@hyperreal.org, JBlaze112@aol.com
CC: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="part1_136.21f4022d.2c465c55_boundary"
X-Mailer: Thunderbird - Mac OS X sub 24
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Rockville Crop Circles

--part1_136.21f4022d.2c465c55_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I'm aware of the claim of the teenagers that suposedly did it but I've also 
read articles that show holes in their story. There are mathamatical problems 
that don't support the methods that the kids claimed to have used in the making 
of the circles, compared to the advanced geometric patterns of the circles in 
the main circle complex.
     It is true that there are now reported two "practice" circles near the 
one that was orginally reported. It is strange that these were found so many 
days later. These circles, very well could have actually been done by the 
teenagers... but did you ever think that the teenagers might have been trying 
(unsucessfully) to imitate the original pictogram? There are many possibilities to 
this story, it is still inconclusive. It's bad journalism to say "Teenagers 
that made them" in those words because the story is inconclusive as of now. It's 
just as bad as saying "Aliens that made them" or "Military that made them". 
     As for Travis AFB... I'm well aware that it's in the area, I have had 
friend stationed there before. But what I saw was three strage UFO's flying 
extreamly low directly over the freeway with triangular red/orange light patterns 
on them (did not look like jets mind you). Also I was an hour or so north east 
from where travis is located. Since this happened within a period of a few 
seconds, yes it is possible that these were some kind of military aircraft that 
I'm not familiar with.   It is also possible that these teenagers have some 
sort of ingenious method of making crop circles that even people who have years 
of experience in the profession of studying crop circles can't figure out. But 
I really dislike it when people jump to conclusions or just pick the most 
likely story and make fun of any other claims. It seems to me like this sort of 
attidute is ALWAYS used towards these stories when they come up. It reminds of 
me of the attitidue of people towards claims of the world not being flat or 
the earth not being the center of the universe. 
     Fair journalism, that's all anyone can ask for. 

--part1_136.21f4022d.2c465c55_boundary--

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Quote of the Day (Wed)

--

In the absence of the gold standard, there is no way to protect savings from confiscation through inflation. ... 
This is the shabby secret of the welfare statists' tirades against gold. Deficit spending is simply a scheme 
for the confiscation of wealth. Gold stands in the way of this insidious process. It stands as a protector of 
property rights. If one grasps this, one has no difficulty in understanding the statists' antagonism toward the 
gold standard.

- Alan Greenspan, Chairman of the US Federal Reserve

If the Market demands it.. Someone will book it..

There was a big ol debate that I posted on this a while back how I mentioned 
how the extort guys promote there party via BSP once a week everyweek till 
there "Monthly" happens. And the lineups only change slightly

And Dina (Dragnfly) Brought up some good points about this crew.. We have to 
keep in mind it is in Suck-of-tomatoes. And not the bay area.. so the 
"Market" is a bit different out there.
She went on to mention that these guys are good guys and not out to screw 
the scene or local comeunity. Which no one implied they were..

BUT!!!! I have a challenge for you XTORT guys.. If people love your parties 
so much and you do a solid event. Then lineup should not really sway your 
attendance.. So how bout you try and book a non lower common denomiter 
lineup and lets see what happpens.

Good example of what im talking about..  When I started going to parties 
Half the time I did not know the DJ's that were on the flyers for "The 
Gatherings" But I still drove my Ass miles out to there events.. Why you 
say?? Cause they Martin O'brien and rest of the crew were known for throwing 
solid events.

Another example.. Till this Day I will attend a FnF,CFC or Viberation or any 
other solid crews party Just based on the date alone I don't need to see the 
lineup or ask how many Lasers they are going to have... why you ask?? Cause 
these said crews throw kick ass parties regardless of who is playing. And 
half the time FnF parties sell out with lil to no promotion at all just word 
of mouth.. Now that is "Keeping the Faith!!!!"

DISCLAIMER:!!!! Now some of the Said DJ's on the XTORT lineups are people 
that I know and have respect for. So NO im not slamming there DJ's one bit 
but more so the way they gear there predicatable lineups.

Macadio

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes

list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 34846 invoked from network); 16 Jul 2003 17:54:52 -0000
Message-ID: <1058382943.3f15a45fda5af@mail.technolounge.org>
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2003 12:15:43 -0700
From: aaron@technolounge.org
To: _ fable _ <fable4our@hotmail.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
References: <LAW11-F126CvqQ7SzE200003b38@hotmail.com>
In-Reply-To: <LAW11-F126CvqQ7SzE200003b38@hotmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
User-Agent: Internet Messaging Program (IMP) 3.0
X-Originating-IP: 204.188.2.1
X-Best-Drink-Ever: Mountain Dew Code Red
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]NRR: Makin beats, findin sounds?

I'd recomend you look into sampling your own sources. A lot of times the 
resources you'll find are the same old tired sounds that everyone on mp3.com is 
using in their music. Try taking existing samples and modifying/effecting them. 
Take a snare and shorten it, change it's attack. Or take a kick drum and layer 
it for a fuller sound. Combine two different synth pads to make a new sample... 
Stuff like that. Play around with your samples in a program like SoundForge and 
you'll probably be able to come up with some stuff that doesn't sound like 
everyone else.

Good luck.

Aaron

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 54242 invoked from network); 16 Jul 2003 18:25:00 -0000
Message-ID: <20030716182456.5515.qmail@web13903.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2003 11:24:56 -0700 (PDT)
From: Brian Lafferty <brianandallison@yahoo.com>
To: _ fable _ <fable4our@hotmail.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <Law11-F107N7DaJHFzr00016388@hotmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]NRR: Makin beats, findin sounds?

I'd say get a digital recorder a halfway decent mic
and head out to the streets. I would suggest taking a
drum stick and a rubber mallet and heading to the UC
Santa Cruz Music buildings. It seems like all of the
surfaces there (i.e. railings and steps) were
engineered to produce different sounds when percussed.
I would check that out. 

Also there is this beach about 4 miles north of the
last stoplight in SC that has this undercut bank and
at low tide the waves hit it.  It makes the deepest
bass resonance I have ever heard. 

Other than that, how about messing with other people's
drum noises like Einsturzende Neubauten's.  They had
everything in their music from a fork on sheetmetal to
a microphone in a fire. 

I got the Archos digital jukebox and have been doing
stuff like that. The only thing is I need a better
mic. 

B

> them.  Take a snare and

> and layer it for a 
> fuller sound. Combine two different synth pads to
> make a new sample..."
>

> lot of samples to work

> odd snare drum files, I just want to build up my
> database so I have more to 
> choose from.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: New toy from Apple.. "Soundtrack"

Looks like a loop-based Acid type thingamajig, but with 24/96 
resolution, support for AU plug-ins and bouncing individual tracks to 
ProTools/Logic/etc.  Supports Acid, AIFF, WAV formats. Seems pretty 
prosumer.. doubt I'd use something like this on its own, but it could 
integrate nicely into an existing recording environment.

http://www.apple.com/soundtrack/

I think this is great overall.. it'll create a lot more laptop 
musicians.  :)

  - omid

From sfraves-return-103885-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed Jul 16 19:09:06 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-103885-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 75314 invoked by uid 1103); 16 Jul 2003 19:09:05 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 75300 invoked from network); 16 Jul 2003 19:09:05 -0000
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2003 15:08:59 -0400
From: ALTRDVISON@aol.com
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Message-ID: <4AAC0AA5.202AA362.09D212BA@aol.com>
X-Mailer: Atlas Mailer 2.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] VRR:Makinbeatsfindinsounds/analog vs digi

2 cents coming at u...
ive been through this the past few months so listen up to some advice.  and we will further the discussion into the familiar battle between digital vs analog and computer vs out board gear.  

lets start by saying i was given an enormous amount of software 12 months ago.  Reason2.0, CubasSX, FM7, Absynth, MoogSynth, the works, u name it i gots it. 
(btw Atmosphere & Stylus are hands down the best ive come across as far as clarity and beef)
to make a very long story short, and to add that i dropped using all my studio/outboard gear to learn these programs.
the studio list consists of a Korg Prophecy, a 909, a SH101
Alesis DM Pro (these are going for 500 bucks now!!! i paid 1k years ago) Sequential Pro One, Emu sampler and some FX.

here goes,
i learned that reason sounds best when Rewired through CubasSX
and separating each track (sound) and to hit it up with the FX section.  VERY nice sound when applying the right FX (ohmboyz,flange, delay,reverb etc.) its the only way to go.
Reason sounds like crap to me if you don't separate the tracks in addition to having a decent sound card.
rex files are low rez as are the drum patches that come with Reason.  the story is, THEY SUCK. canned fruit.

after 6 months of this with reason, most of my outboard sits and collects dust.  6 months later i drop reason and turn all the external gear on.

WHAT HAPPENED!?! the sound coming from my external gear IS FAR
superior as far as clarity and low end (u will notice reason sounds tingly-high-end-hard-to-get-a-real-sound-out-of-tha thing) canned fruit we call it (fruity loops anyone)

its as simple as this.  the software is NICE! 
BUT, you will get a MUCH cleaner more defined sound if you just take your time and build your studio piece by piece.
check out music swap shops, hell check ebay.  stuff is around for cheap.  and by-the-way...
GO ANALOG.
i have also found, and yes the Nord , Virus , and the like are awesome face punching synths, but a keyboard like any vintage korg or roland, or even the Alesis Andromeda blow all that digital crap away hands down don't even respond back to this cuz i ait listnin and if you cant take 10 years worth of advice go learn it the hard way.  also stay away from bang for the buck boxes like electribes and such.  it aint worth it.

and oh yea, i do pick up a sample disk once in a while. even picked up the Creative Essentials for Reason and it was a big fat waist of 150 bucks.  shoulda saved it for the studio.  live and learn.

Jon 



---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves]NRR: Makin beats, findin sounds?

----- Original Message -----
From: "_ fable _" <fable4our@hotmail.com>

> I am coming to the point where I may actually have to spend
> money(gasp) on some new samples and patches.

Instead of spending time and money acquiring a CD of patches someone else
has made, why not spend it learning some synthesis basics so you can create
your own.  Knowing even just the basics of waveforms, filters, envelopes,
etc... will allow you to make the synths sound like you want them to sound.
A lot of the time it's frustrating trying to get the Subtractor and
Maelstrom (or any synth for that matter, but those two in particular) to
sound a certain way just by "tweaking" the parameters; but if you understand
what sort of waveform you're trying to create and how to adjust the synths
to generate that waveform, you'll be a lot more successful.

just my .02 $

jonathan


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Snare drum was a golf ball thrown down a hallway.

them, mangle them beyond recognition. Not even for
loops necessarily, anything.

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm

Received: (qmail 4205 invoked from network); 16 Jul 2003 20:07:00 -0000
Message-ID: <020801c34bd6$24e81560$0a00000a@dawgbuddha>
From: "jonathan | dawgbuddha | net" <jonathan@dawgbuddha.net>
To: <ALTRDVISON@aol.com>, <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
References: <4AAC0AA5.202AA362.09D212BA@aol.com>
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2003 12:33:40 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.50.4807.1700
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.50.4910.0300
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] VRR:Makinbeatsfindinsounds/analog vs digi

with all due respect for your ten years of experience, ALTRD, i think your
advice is tremendously short-sighted.  to say that in ALL cases one might
achieve more "clarity" and "beef" out of a broad category of equipment such
as "analog" vs. "digital" gear or outboard vs. plug-ins is foolish.  things
like clarity, crispness, definition, and body are dependent upon a multitude
of factors.  i've heard digital set-ups that sound incredibly clean and warm
and analog set-ups that sound totally hollow and crappy.  i know a number of
producers on this list who can create incredible sounding stuff in Reason or
on an Electribe, and a number of producers who have access to millions of
dollars of high-end gear who can't make shit.  the fact of the matter is,
there's no piece of "magic" gear; the principal factor in the quality of
your productions is always going to be your TALENT, not how much money you
spent on a studio set-up.  yeah, it's true that a 50k+ protools HD rig is
probably gonna sound better than a PC with a Soundblaster card running
Reason, but all that gear is still just a TOOL; what matters is how it's
used.

-- jonathan




----- Original Message -----
From: <ALTRDVISON@aol.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, July 16, 2003 12:08 PM
Subject: [sfraves] VRR:Makinbeatsfindinsounds/analog vs digi


> 2 cents coming at u...
> ive been through this the past few months so listen up to some advice.
and we will further the discussion into the familiar battle between digital
vs analog and computer vs out board gear.
>
> lets start by saying i was given an enormous amount of software 12 months
ago.  Reason2.0, CubasSX, FM7, Absynth, MoogSynth, the works, u name it i
gots it.
> (btw Atmosphere & Stylus are hands down the best ive come across as far as
clarity and beef)
> to make a very long story short, and to add that i dropped using all my
studio/outboard gear to learn these programs.
> the studio list consists of a Korg Prophecy, a 909, a SH101
> Alesis DM Pro (these are going for 500 bucks now!!! i paid 1k years ago)
Sequential Pro One, Emu sampler and some FX.
>
> here goes,
> i learned that reason sounds best when Rewired through CubasSX
> and separating each track (sound) and to hit it up with the FX section.
VERY nice sound when applying the right FX (ohmboyz,flange, delay,reverb
etc.) its the only way to go.
> Reason sounds like crap to me if you don't separate the tracks in addition
to having a decent sound card.
> rex files are low rez as are the drum patches that come with Reason.  the
story is, THEY SUCK. canned fruit.
>
> after 6 months of this with reason, most of my outboard sits and collects
dust.  6 months later i drop reason and turn all the external gear on.
>
> WHAT HAPPENED!?! the sound coming from my external gear IS FAR
> superior as far as clarity and low end (u will notice reason sounds
tingly-high-end-hard-to-get-a-real-sound-out-of-tha thing) canned fruit we
call it (fruity loops anyone)
>
> its as simple as this.  the software is NICE!
> BUT, you will get a MUCH cleaner more defined sound if you just take your
time and build your studio piece by piece.
> check out music swap shops, hell check ebay.  stuff is around for cheap.
and by-the-way...
> GO ANALOG.
> i have also found, and yes the Nord , Virus , and the like are awesome
face punching synths, but a keyboard like any vintage korg or roland, or
even the Alesis Andromeda blow all that digital crap away hands down don't
even respond back to this cuz i ait listnin and if you cant take 10 years
worth of advice go learn it the hard way.  also stay away from bang for the
buck boxes like electribes and such.  it aint worth it.
>
> and oh yea, i do pick up a sample disk once in a while. even picked up the
Creative Essentials for Reason and it was a big fat waist of 150 bucks.
shoulda saved it for the studio.  live and learn.
>
> Jon
>
>
>

On Wednesday, July 16, 2003, at 12:55 PM, Giles Bowkett wrote:

To the person who didn't want any responses (that's asking for plenty 
of responses) re: outboard equipment and a decade of expertise. Yes, 
outboard equipment is and probably always will be better in terms of 
sound quality, etc., but the original question was posed by someone 
using a digital solution. Secondly, as it always comes up in these 
threads, the quality/accuracy/whatever of digital emulation vs. 
dedicated hardware completely takes a back seat to whether the music is 
any good! :)

I have about zero dollars in my studio budget, and I'm not all that 
great at tweaking the hell out of sounds or even producing the cleanest 
sounds when I record. I get my greatest satisfaction not from when a 
listener appreciates the technical accuracy of my recordings, but from 
where the piece of music takes them, if it meets (or defies) particular 
expectations, etc. Maybe I'm too much of a pop-song-writer type, but to 
me, the message matters more than the technology used to convey it.

  - omid

--Apple-Mail-36-622599455--

Subject: Re: [sfraves]NRR: Makin beats, findin sounds?

> outboard equipment is and probably always will be better in terms of 
> sound quality, etc., but the original question was posed by someone 

Bullshit.

Analog has yet to be perfectly emulated.  Digital is digital.  Anything that
you can do in a Virus or Nord, you can do in host-native software.  Virus
and Nord and all the digital synths are nothing more than host native
software on a different host.

Just because Nord hasn't ported their NordLead software to a PC or Mac,
doesn't make it anything more special than software.

On Wednesday, July 16, 2003, at 01:22 PM, Tim Hockin wrote:

>> outboard equipment is and probably always will be better in terms of
>> sound quality, etc., but the original question was posed by someone
>
> Bullshit.
>
> Analog has yet to be perfectly emulated.  Digital is digital.  
> Anything that
> you can do in a Virus or Nord, you can do in host-native software.  
> Virus
> and Nord and all the digital synths are nothing more than host native
> software on a different host.

Perfectly good point, and I hadn't differentiated between digital and 
analog ;)  At any rate, the big point I was trying to make was that 
arguing over the bits and bytes and sound quality don't mean anything 
if you can't put a tune together for shit. EN (I can't freakin spell it 
right now) made just as interesting stuff by hammering on bedsprings as 
Throbbing Gristle did with playing with noise and Sonic Youth has done 
with feedback and Orbital does with a fortress of gear.

I've had a problem with 60hz hum on my guitar amp, and I can't stand 
it, but when putting a track together recently, it was more important 
to me to get the whole thing working as a track first...

  - omid

so, i was thinking about what is available, and sometimes, there are things that are available that i am just not interested in seeing or participating in...often actually...not to be insensitive, but i totally am not into going out and having some chick(s) wear something for "me".  now, maybe that sounds insensitive, but really, who is being more insensitive? someone subjecting you to their "outfit", and beauty is in the eye of the beholder, for sure, so, ummm, anyway, i usually don't say anything about that sort of thing...i figure it is just circumstance when someone thinks that i am there for the "show", when quite frankly, i am generally all ears, unless it is really  bad, then i am not there at all in mind and spirit...i just kind of peak out every once and a while to make sure all is clear so that i am can go back to that mental space far away from the "show". :)

Subject: [sfraves] Recent Rave Act News

--=====================_3458372==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

RAVE ACT:  Drug Policy Alliance


Our supporters fought hard to try to stop the Illicit Drug 
Anti-Proliferation Act (more commonly known as the RAVE Act) from becoming 
law, but a handful of career politicians ignored the public's sensible 
concerns and enacted the measure without a hearing or public debate. With 
your help, the Drug Policy Alliance continues to challenge this bad law.


In the wake of a recent incident in Billings, Montana where the DEA used 
the threat of the Illicit Drug Anti-Proliferation Act to shut down a 
medical marijuana fundraiser, we asked you to send faxes to the DEA 
demanding they adopt guidelines or regulations to stop such abuses. We also 
asked you to fax Senator Biden (the sponsor of the law) and your Members of 
Congress to urge them to pressure the DEA to adopt such guidelines.


Since you took action, Senator Biden has strongly criticized the Billings, 
Montana incident and pushed the DEA to enforce the law in a fair and proper 
manner.  Whenever possible we thank our legislators for doing the right 
thing.  Although we continue to have concerns about the Illicit Drug 
Anti-Proliferation Act we commend Senator Biden for taking such important 
steps. Senator Durbin and other Members of Congress have also criticized 
the DEA's actions. Bowing to this public pressure, the DEA has adopted new 
internal guidelines.  We are certain that Senator Biden's intervention was 
a key to restraining these DEA abuses.


While new DEA guidelines do not have the force of law (which is why the 
Drug Policy Alliance strongly supports reforming the law), we hope they 
will provide important protections for our civil liberties. Unfortunately, 
the DEA has refused to release the details of their new guidelines. The 
Drug Policy Alliance is submitting a Freedom of Information Act Request to 
require the DEA to provide the American people with copies of the guidelines.


In the meantime, voters continue to organize around the country to pressure 
Congress to change the law and the Drug Policy Alliance is putting together 
a legislative coalition to repeal or reform it. A major musical 
demonstration against the Illicit Drug Anti-Proliferation Act is planned 
for September 6th in front of the Senate. We hope to see you there!


Read the DEA's letter to Sen. Biden on the Billings, Montana Incident:
  http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=2736


Read Senator Biden's probing questions of President Bush's nominee to head 
the DEA and her answers:
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=2737


Read Senator Durbin's tough questions to Bush's nominee and her answers:
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=2738


Read what the DEA is saying about the new guidelines on their website:
  http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=2739



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

hey there...really sorry to do this, but we're getting pretty desperate...there is a lot of stuff available now, but we really really really want to keep our place, it's really really nice.
 
we need a new female roommate...2 bathrooms, top floor, sunny, airy etc. 3-bedroom apartment in the inner richmond.  you get the biggest room for $700 and a small deposit.  gas, water, trash included.  utilities = $10/month (we use cell phones for long distance).  around the corner from 24-hour supermarket and uber-cheap farmer's market, near wonderful clement street etc. inner richmond.  we're usf grads..artsy, fun, independent girls. renting month to month until december.
 
location: anza between 3rd and 4th avenues.
no smoking, not 420 friendly, no pets. 
 
if you or you know someone who might be interested please hit me back off the list.
 
cheers,
 
miss g (lauren)

out of the country in a week to Costa Rica.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BPM Covers Hyperreal

=09=09  _=09     _=09 u
Pronounciation: (hi) (p=EEr) (re) (al)

History of Hyperreal:

http://hyperreal.org/info/history.html

circa 1994

"...the pc, a pentium 90, went under his desk at wired, was hooked up to
their lan and was given a public ip address. he chose a domain name for it
in honor one of his favorite techno tracks at the time: 'hyperreal' by the
shamen. (specifically, the jack dangers remix of that song). the machine
name, taz, was a reference to hakim bey's entry on every cyberpunk's
essential reading list: 'T.A.Z. - the Temporary Autonomous Zone,
Ontological Anarchy, Poetic Terrorism'..."

:)
paix,
karina
**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

aye - i thought that MAYBE someone out there might possibly be =
interested in what i am about to say....


------------------------------------------------------

I just recently watched a movie named "who is cletis tout" and let me =
tell you, this has some kick ass directing (sort of along the lines of =
Tarantino) with a humurous yet interesting plot.


Who is Cletis Tout? (2002)
    =20

            comedy     Prison escapee Trevor Finch (Christian Slater) =
assumes the identity of a deceased man, Cletis Tout, but soon discovers =
that someone had put out a hit on Cletis. Now, as Finch and fellow =
escapee Micah (Richard Dreyfuss) race to recover Micah's hidden =
diamonds, they must outrun not only the police but hit man Critical Jim =
(Tim Allen), as well! Portia de Rossi plays Finch's girlfriend, Tess, in =
this caper comedy. =20

    =20



-------------------------------------------------

i also recently watched the movie "Wasabi" which is a french film that =
was made in 2001. if you get it on DVD you can choose to watch the =
original French version, or the dubbed English version. I watched about =
quarter of the movie dubbed then switched to the French version. I must =
say that i prefer the French version (with subtitles)


Wasabi (2001)
    =20

            action     Hubert (Jean Reno) is a police inspector who =
receives a telephone call from Japan one day informing him that Miko =
(Yuki Sakai), the love of his life who disappeared nearly 20 years ago, =
has died under strange circumstances. She hasn't forgotten him -- in =
fact, she's named him executor of her will. But what Hubert soon =
discovers is that he's been saddled with a handful of problems -- and a =
daughter (Ryoko Hirosue) he never knew he had! =20
    =20


-------------------------------------------------

and if you like French films, then you should also check out Amelie.


Amelie (2001)
Le Fabuleux destin d'Am=E9lie Poulain
    =20

            foreign     Impish gamine Am=E9lie (Audrey Tautou) lives =
alone and works in a caf=E9. When she finds a trove of toys hidden for =
40 years behind a baseboard in her apartment, she's inspired to =
repatriate the items, an impulse of generosity that sparks more =
benevolent acts. A celebration of life, Am=E9lie reminds us of the small =
wonders that abound around us . if only we paused to look. =20
    =20


---------------------------------------------------



---
Timothy Penner
AIM :: CheeseHHC
itswidow@hotmail.com
http://BayAreaRavers.com
http://HardcoreForThePeople.com

  Who is Cletis Tout? (2002)
      =20

              comedy     Prison escapee Trevor Finch (Christian Slater) =
assumes the identity of a deceased man, Cletis Tout, but soon discovers =
that someone had put out a hit on Cletis. Now, as Finch and fellow =
escapee Micah (Richard Dreyfuss) race to recover Micah's hidden =
diamonds, they must outrun not only the police but hit man Critical Jim =
(Tim Allen), as well! Portia de Rossi plays Finch's girlfriend, Tess, in =
this caper comedy. =20

  -------------------------------------------------

  i also recently watched the movie "Wasabi" which is a french film that =
was made in 2001. if you get it on DVD you can choose to watch the =
original French version, or the dubbed English version. I watched about =
quarter of the movie dubbed then switched to the French version. I must =
say that i prefer the French version (with subtitles)


  Wasabi (2001)
      =20

              action     Hubert (Jean Reno) is a police inspector who =
receives a telephone call from Japan one day informing him that Miko =
(Yuki Sakai), the love of his life who disappeared nearly 20 years ago, =
has died under strange circumstances. She hasn't forgotten him -- in =
fact, she's named him executor of her will. But what Hubert soon =
discovers is that he's been saddled with a handful of problems -- and a =
daughter (Ryoko Hirosue) he never knew he had! =20
      =20


  -------------------------------------------------

  Amelie (2001)
  Le Fabuleux destin d'Am=E9lie Poulain
      =20

              foreign     Impish gamine Am=E9lie (Audrey Tautou) lives =
alone and works in a caf=E9. When she finds a trove of toys hidden for =
40 years behind a baseboard in her apartment, she's inspired to =
repatriate the items, an impulse of generosity that sparks more =
benevolent acts. A celebration of life, Am=E9lie reminds us of the small =
wonders that abound around us . if only we paused to look. =20

>aye - i thought that MAYBE someone out there might possibly be interested 
>in what i am about to say....
>
>
>------------------------------------------------------
>
>I just recently watched a movie named "who is cletis tout" and let me tell 
>you, this has some kick ass directing (sort of along the lines of 
>Tarantino) with a humurous yet interesting plot.
>
>
>Who is Cletis Tout? (2002)
>
>
>             comedy     Prison escapee Trevor Finch (Christian Slater) 
>assumes the identity of a deceased man, Cletis Tout, but soon discovers 
>that someone had put out a hit on Cletis. Now, as Finch and fellow escapee 
>Micah (Richard Dreyfuss) race to recover Micah's hidden diamonds, they must 
>outrun not only the police but hit man Critical Jim (Tim Allen), as well! 
>Portia de Rossi plays Finch's girlfriend, Tess, in this caper comedy.
>
>
>
>
>
>-------------------------------------------------
>
>i also recently watched the movie "Wasabi" which is a french film that was 
>made in 2001. if you get it on DVD you can choose to watch the original 
>French version, or the dubbed English version. I watched about quarter of 
>the movie dubbed then switched to the French version. I must say that i 
>prefer the French version (with subtitles)
>
>
>Wasabi (2001)
>
>
>             action     Hubert (Jean Reno) is a police inspector who 
>receives a telephone call from Japan one day informing him that Miko (Yuki 
>Sakai), the love of his life who disappeared nearly 20 years ago, has died 
>under strange circumstances. She hasn't forgotten him -- in fact, she's 
>named him executor of her will. But what Hubert soon discovers is that he's 
>been saddled with a handful of problems -- and a daughter (Ryoko Hirosue) 
>he never knew he had!
>
>
>
>-------------------------------------------------
>
>and if you like French films, then you should also check out Amelie.
>
>
>Amelie (2001)
>Le Fabuleux destin d'Amélie Poulain
>
>
>             foreign     Impish gamine Amélie (Audrey Tautou) lives alone 
>and works in a café. When she finds a trove of toys hidden for 40 years 
>behind a baseboard in her apartment, she's inspired to repatriate the 
>items, an impulse of generosity that sparks more benevolent acts. A 
>celebration of life, Amélie reminds us of the small wonders that abound 
>around us . if only we paused to look.
>
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------
>
>
>

>AIM :: CheeseHHC
>itswidow@hotmail.com

and

Subject: [sfraves] atlantis postponed - aug. 23rd

posted on bayraves.com by ron reeser.  also on www.clockworkpresents.com

------

Attention ATLANTIS party goers:

Over the years Clockwork has hosted some of the largest Electronic Music 
Festivals in Northern California including…METROPOLIS, UNDERWORLD, ONCE IN A 
BLUE MOON, ATLANTIS and MOONSHINE OVER AMERICA.

Our goal is to continue to bring you some of the most memorable Electronic 
Music Festivals around. Due to circumstances beyond our control we have 
decided to postpone ATLANTIS to Saturday August 23rd, 2003. This will allow 
us to bring you a bigger, better and more diverse line up of talent.

Stay Tuned for:
_ More International & Local Headliners To Be Announced.
_ Added Hip Hop Artists
_ Massive Capacity
_ Indoor & Outdoor Activities
_ Carnival Rides
_ Extreme Sports

New information will be released on the weekend of July 26, 2003 with full 
line up & venue location.

For more info Log onto our website:
www.clockworkevents.com | www.clockworkpresents.com
Call our 24hr. event info lines: 408.795.5822 | 415.721.3736 | 510.835.6337

ATLANTIS FAQ’S:
Is ATLANTIS still happening?
Yes ATLANTIS is still happening, but it has been moved to Sat. August 23rd, 
2003.

Why did ATLANTIS get moved to a later date?
We decided to alter the style of the event by adding more International & 
Local Headliners, Hip Hop Artists, Greater capacity, Indoor & Outdoor 
Activities and Extreme Sports.

Is ATLANTIS still in Richmond?
No. It has been moved to San Francisco. We wanted to provide you with a more 
central location and a safer environment.

What do we do about our Pre-Sale tickets that we already purchased for 
ATLANTIS?
For those who purchased Pre-sale tickets for ATLANTIS Saturday July 19th, 
2003 tickets will be honored on Saturday August 23rd, 2003.

We dearly apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused…

_________________________________________________________________

http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

Subject: [sfraves] DANNY HOWELLS Boat Party This Sunday BeeSSSpee

------=_NextPart_000_001F_01C34CA2.061C8090
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all - in case you didn't know, one of the best, and one of my =
favorite DJs, is coming to SF to play at the kinkyfunk boat party this =
sunday.  the one and only danny howells.

i was trying to think of what to say to convey how much fun his sets are =
and how much people who are into quality progressive tech-house electro =
funk fun music need to be here for this party, then i saw the article in =
the examiner about him and thought it was a good start.  this really is =
a unique opportunity to hear one of the best, in his prime (versus some =
other big djs that shall remain nameless...)!

http://www.sfexaminer.com/arts/default.jsp?story=3D071703a_howells =
(pasted below too)

thump radio resident house djs on the upper deck.  :)

so any of you self respecting prog heads out there - you should have =
your tickets already!  we'll see ya there with those big grins on your =
face!

come out onto the high seas with us sunday - you will not regret it...

tickets available on www.thumpradio.com

peas!

-brian

ps. does function 1 sound mean anything to you?  ;)

DJ Howells climbs aboard Kinkyfunk Boat Party.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------=
-------
By Bill Picture
Of The Examiner Staff
bpicture@examiner.com
Published on Thursday, July 17, 2003

-------------------------------------------------------------------------=
-------

DJ Danny Howells has often described his love of music as more of an =
addiction. Maybe that's why he's been affectionately dubbed "the =
clubber's DJ" by fellow junkies around the world and on both sides of =
the decks.=20
So naturally, when much-heralded U.K. label Global Underground, arguably =
Europe's kings of the double-CD mix, decided to launch a brand new mix =
CD series devoted to people who eat, sleep and breathe music, Howells =
was the first person they went to.=20

The English DJ, and all- around fine bloke, headlines Sunday's Kinkyfunk =
Boat Party, whipping up an on-the-water mix of deep and dirty =
full-spectrum house in celebration of the upcoming release of Global =
Underground's "24:7 Danny Howells."=20

"I'm gonna have to have a word with Dahi when I arrive," jokes Howells, =
referring to Dahi Donnelly, who together with partner Brian Sheehy, =
helped organize Sunday's shindig. "I did a track called 'Kinkyfunk' a =
few years back and that Dahi stole the name for his party."=20

Howell's new CD won't hit stores here in the U.S. until Tuesday but the =
"24:7" promotional tour kicked off months ago and the veteran DJ says =
he's already earned enough frequent-flyer miles to take a nice holiday, =
if he ever gets the chance.=20

"I think I've discovered a new kind of (DJ) ailment," he says. "I did a =
12-hour set the other night and when I got back to my hotel, I had =
friction burns in a rather embarrassing place from all that wiggling =
about."=20

These marathon sets, a nightmare for some DJs, have become Howell's =
specialty. The graduate of British progressive house royalty John =
Digweed's school of Bedrock currently holds a coveted monthly Saturday =
night residency at New York megaclub Arc; and his already legendary =
10-hour sets there are gabbed about on Monday via the club's online =
message board with the same degree of reverence usually reserved for =
rock stars.=20

"Back when I had a day job doing sh-- work, I thought an eight-hour =
workday was long," he jokes. "But actually, it goes by pretty quick =
because I'm having such a good time. Sometimes, I'm having so much fun =
that I actually forget to even go to the bathroom."=20

The new CD, he says, is a taste of what he's been listening to lately at =
home, in the car, in his hotel room and on the plane, tracks that he =
loved to death but had trouble finding a home for.=20

"They're really gorgeous little tracks," he explains, "but a lot of them =
are really spooky and cold and I just didn't think they worked well in =
one of my regular sets. I knew they'd work well together, though, so I =
just put them in a little pile at home for the next project."=20

So when Global Underground founders James Todd and Andy Horsfield =
knocked on Howells' door with the idea for a new series about life in =
and beyond the club -- the first disc features a daytime, chill-out, for =
lack of a better description, mix and the second, a nighttime, dance =
floor mix -- he knew the records he'd been stockpiling at home would =
work perfectly.=20

"When I started working on (the project), I wasn't concerned with style, =
really," he says. "I was trying to create more of a feeling or a mood. =
The record goes through a really wide range of styles, but the mood is =
pretty constant. It's pretty dark and a lot of the tracks have this sort =
of melancholic vibe, but it's really sexy, too."=20

Howells says he couldn't be more pleased with the end result or with the =
opportunities that seem to keep coming his way and believes he owes his =
success of late to his rather organic approach to business.=20

"I just sort of let things happen, really," he says. "My only plans for =
the future are to get married someday and have children, maybe do some =
gardening. Other than that, I don't really have any plans. I'm just =
gonna carry on as I am."=20

Kinkyfunk Boat Party featuring Danny Howells
Boat leaves Pier 9 at 6:00 p.m. SHARP on Sunday. Tickets are $35 =
advance/$40 day of event. Call (415) 543-3505 or visit =
www.electrocelt.com. For more information on Danny Howells, visit =
www.dannyhowells.com.



------=_NextPart_000_001F_01C34CA2.061C8090--

remember when they'd phone each other and do math problems in black sharpies on yellow legal pads and they'd be like 'do all these steps and at the end the number will be 5' or something like that...they even had some space suit skit...then there were those claymation figures they used to try to teach about negative numbers and stuff.  what a rad show.  my favotie. i was watching it when the 1989 quake happened...we felt it in friggin' Madera, by fresno. anyhoo, yeah great show. monday and tuesday...haha.  oh oh and there was that dude with the card games, he was a magician and they'd do math tricks in the dressing room. way fun. ok i'll stop now.  
 
miss g

So *no* we don't have Danny Howells playing our event this Sunday, or =
even playing the after party (and we do wish him the very best with his =
boat party because Howells rocks), but we do have some favorite local =
DJ's putting it down in the East Bay this Sunday. So if you like your =
beats deep, mean and bubbling over with tribal ferociousness, and don't =
want to shell out the $35.00 bucks for the boat, come see what we have =
to offer. Just remember how sorry you guys felt when you chose to go to =
Hybrid last time and missed out ;-)

This Weeks Guest, the man himself:
KEITH EDWARDS

Your Hosts and Resident DJ's:
DJ Jack Triumph
(Qo=F6l Happy Hour, Frisky Radio, KZSU Radio, jacktriumph.com)

DJ Mike Ward
(BoardStock, enuriye, Paragon Lounge)

every 3rd Sunday of the Month at:
The Popi Lounge=20
3059 Hopyard Road
Pleasanton CA.=20

Join us this summer as enuriye productions has put together a Sunday =
experience that will be featuring weekly guest DJ's, 4-deck progressive =
battle sessions, and "FireLand" who will bring "fire-and-light" visual =
entertainment. For those who haven't experienced an enuriye gathering, =
this will entail some serious tribal/progressive madness starting @ 8 pm =
and continuing until we decide to stop. Join our family and experience =
what an awesome year it has been musically for our DJ's of this =
up-and-coming progressive collective.

Come out, enjoy some drinks from the overly stocked bar @ the Popi and =
catch a night of pulsating progressive anthems that will prepare you for =
the week ahead.

21 +
Ladies free before 10 pm - $2 after
Guys - $2
$1 for all when you bring this flyer
http://www.jacktriumph.com/Sacred_Institution_Flyer.jpg

Date: Fri, 18 Jul 2003 11:01:58 -0700
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
From: Omid Tavallai <otavallai@mac.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
In-Reply-To: <00ea01c34d55$42172d80$191ae4d1@na.cp.net>
Message-Id: <ECBC518C-B949-11D7-865B-000393D58BFE@mac.com>
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Some crazy show on PBS

I think I'd outgrown daytime PBS by the time Square One TV and Mathman 
were on the scene, although I do remember seeing them.

My summer daytimes were spent getting fat and lazy in front of the TV 
in the name of cultural diversity. Vegetable Soup, High Feather... it's 
interesting how a lot of these shows promoted diversity long before the 
"PC" movement started.  Even Electric Company and Sesame Street went a 
long way to have people of different ethnic backgrounds while all the 
other programming geared toward kids was stuck in Father-Knows-Best 
suburbialand.

For a kid growing up as a mutant freak in Sunnyvale, it helped me deal 
with being "different."  While race and ethnicity are still issues, 
it's nice to see that some shows have progressed to embrace different 
"types."  Pretty soon, I'm sure Canadian import Degrassi Jr. High will 
have b-boys mingling with ravers mingling with preps mingling with 
goths mingling with punks...   I think those are more divisive lines 
than anything, at least in our area these days.

Kudos to PBS...


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

------

Attention ATLANTIS party goers:

Over the years Clockwork has hosted some of the largest Electronic Music

Festivals in Northern California including=85METROPOLIS, UNDERWORLD, =
ONCE
IN A=20
BLUE MOON, ATLANTIS and MOONSHINE OVER AMERICA.

Our goal is to continue to bring you some of the most memorable
Electronic=20
Music Festivals around. Due to circumstances beyond our control we have=20
decided to postpone ATLANTIS to Saturday August 23rd, 2003. This will
allow=20
us to bring you a bigger, better and more diverse line up of talent.

Stay Tuned for:
_ More International & Local Headliners To Be Announced.
_ Added Hip Hop Artists
_ Massive Capacity
_ Indoor & Outdoor Activities
_ Carnival Rides
_ Extreme Sports

New information will be released on the weekend of July 26, 2003 with
full=20
line up & venue location.

For more info Log onto our website:
www.clockworkevents.com | www.clockworkpresents.com
Call our 24hr. event info lines: 408.795.5822 | 415.721.3736 |
510.835.6337

ATLANTIS FAQ=92S:
Is ATLANTIS still happening?
Yes ATLANTIS is still happening, but it has been moved to Sat. August
23rd,=20
2003.

Why did ATLANTIS get moved to a later date?
We decided to alter the style of the event by adding more International
&=20
Local Headliners, Hip Hop Artists, Greater capacity, Indoor & Outdoor=20
Activities and Extreme Sports.

Is ATLANTIS still in Richmond?
No. It has been moved to San Francisco. We wanted to provide you with a
more=20
central location and a safer environment.

What do we do about our Pre-Sale tickets that we already purchased for=20
ATLANTIS?
For those who purchased Pre-sale tickets for ATLANTIS Saturday July
19th,=20
2003 tickets will be honored on Saturday August 23rd, 2003.

We dearly apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused=85

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Great deal on .mp3 player...

yeah, so when are we all going to start sharing our MP3's :-)

I own an 15G 3rd generation IPOD... I dunno, but the JB3 seemed kinda *huge* 
to me. I like to rollerblade and put the player in my pocket. And people
would think I'm far gladder to see them than I actually am, were I to pocket
the JB3. (BTW, if you see a big tall guy in a shiny metallic blue helmet with
built-in silver headphones skating at 
embaracero/marina/ftmasongreen/goldengatepark, or just slaloming down
the middle of haight street after dining at Blue Front Cafe, well that's
me!... ).

The Nomad Zen USB 2 seems cool as well, though I hear it is not very 
shock/motion resistant. Is it true that when you open the bag for this
device it says "No jogging"... how does your NJB3 stand up to constant
motion??

But... 200 is a good price for the NJB3... but If I were to do it over again
(and I might just return this Ipod for something that just lets me
drag-and-drop directories of MP3s and listen to them, like god intended us to)
I'd get an archos recorder 20 and run Rockbox (http://rockbox.haxx.se/) on it.
IPODs still kinda suck on windows, cuz you have to use Music Match Jukebox, 
which is kind-of-a-complete-piece-of-shit.

Subject: [sfraves] A Pattern (revisited)

This poem is fucka old.  I done writ it back in 1992. 
I know I posted it here several years ago, but I just
sent it out to Fable, and then I re-read it and found
some embarrassing typos, sloppy spots, and tired
images.  

So here's the '03 remix.  I hope the formatting goes
OK through e-mail.

cunnilingus & whippets,
boomerang
.... .  .   .

	
     A PATTERN	© 1992 Peter Sandifer	

A seagull skims the ocean at dawn--
Youth.
The flutter of wings, the dust of feathers;
a raven in the churchyard caws.

The earth will find her way--
these revolutions work on circuits.

Time.  Our greatest game.  
You've been,
	    You've thought,
			   You've seen,
You've twisted this spiral before.

10:21 a.m.
Tuesday.
A fetus settles into the vacuum.
A pause in creation--
She will be reborn.  
She will find her way back out.

God's fingers work absurd mathematics
on the humble scales of time--
			and hereness
			and nowness
in human weight
make no sense to the stars.

The churchyard at dusk:
Poets and politicians and junkies rot.
A raven picks the frozen ground.
The earth buckles from frost.
A fencepost leans with weariness.

An ancient oak by the graveyard's edge:
Naked branches break skyward
Again and again
	again and again
		in perfect patterns, 
feeling for heaven.  
As instinct.

Springtime.
One minute to midnight.
The grass glitters with wetness, 
      and worlds below.
The children dance until dawn.
A synthetic heartbeat pounds
between earth and womb,
or gravity and flight:
	boom boom boom boom
	boom boom boom boom
One hundred and twenty beats per minute.

"Meaningless! Meaningless!"
cries the child to the ancient stars.
"Utterly meaningless!
Everything is meaningless!"

The planets line in soldiers’ stance:
			Hup, two, three, four.
			Hup, two, three, four.
A pattern.
	A pattern.
		A pattern.
What has been done will be done again.

A baby is born.
A heartbeat tapers.
Gravestones mold and crumble.

A seagull grazes the ocean at dawn.

There is nothing new under the sun.









Several lines hijacked from the Book of Ecclesiastes: 
Meaningless! Meaningless! ...
What has been done will be done again.
There is nothing new under the sun.
		












---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Himp-Hoxp: Improvised Experimental Hip-Hop
A collaboration between musicians from the experimental music and 
underground hip-hop communities. Beatmakers, turntablists, instrumentalists 
and mc's will be placed in various groups to improvise new experimental hip 
hop songs.
Glen Galaxy (Soul Junk - San Diego) - MC
Bizzart (LA)- MC
Reign - MC
MC Antiseptic (Create! - LA) - MC/Bass
Jon Brumit - Sampler/Turntable/Effects
Matt Davignon - Turntable/Sampler/Drum Machine
Ernesto Diaz-Infante - Guitar
Lance Grabmiller - Laptop or Turntable
Walter Kitundu - Turntables/Inventions
Alexander Kort (Subtle) - Electric Cello
Andrew Pompey (Create! - LA) - Drums
LX Rudis - Beats/CD Turntables
Stephen Ruiz - Beats

Chris Schlarb (Create! - LA) - Guitar

Subject: [sfraves] Cloud 9 >F Friday< was soooooooo Dope!

OK... so I was like having this mondo shitty week 'cause grrr... on goes the job hunt & I like grrr... well... I'm doin' alot alot alot & well... I hope something happens soon...

Anywaze... my homegirl Dhoris wanted 2 go out & Joey posted somewhere about him spinning @ Cloud ( 4 F Friday & I told her we should go there & we went!!  Oooooooh man... I'm sooooo glad we went! I mean... I so like almost told Dhoris I didn't wanna go out 'cause I was in this mondo unplurry mood...

OK... I really gotta say that this 1 DJ totally made my whole crappy week get better... his name is Dimitris Mykonos!  I mean... he totally got off like spinning Deep Funky Chicago HOuse & oh yeah... yummy scratches all around!  BUt what totally made his set totally orgasmic was when he dropped in this like Breakbeats track w/ this bad ass dark acid melody that played throughout the song!!  Ohhhhh my Goodness, Oh My GOsh, Hello 2Day... I Totally Loved it!!!

As soon as he was done spinning, I totally had 2 Thank him 4 that up[lifting set!!  He told me that him making my night totally made his night!  But I'm gonna be in the area again 2morrow night so he told me 2 pass by & he'll gimme a demo!!

But all the DJs were Dope!!!!  David Harness was spinning some Dope ass Disco House!!  Frenchy LeFreak, oh gosh, he totally went everywhere & it was Awesome!!  I mean... he busted out Salsa House, Played some slammin' house w/ yummy hard house beats, he even spun this 1 minimal house (if possible) track that was funky & Dope!

BUt OK... Hello 2Day... Joey came on after Dimitris & ooooh man... he totally brought on a totally different flavor... but totally Groovin' set 4 what I was there for!!  I can't even describe what Joey was spinning 'cause it was soooo good & man.... so Dope!  I mean... I dunno... all his shit was totally pumpin, I was totally on the Groove oh oh oh... what was Dope was Joey put on this scratch recored & was doin' his business... them Dimitris went on & totally went off & started scratching during Joey set!  I haven't seen DJs share a record like that in a long time!  It was Groovy!

OK... the crowd was totally mixed... I mean... when Dhoris & I 1st like got there... it was fillled w/ preppies everywhere which was alright!  Then more Groovers started coming in!!  I mean... the vibe was kinda uptight 4 a while.... but it got really nice!!!

I had soooo much fun 2night & got a lil' sloshed 2 add!!  YAY.. fun night!  I mean... it was totally refreshing goin' 2 an all house event!!  Thanks Frenchy, Thank U Thank U Thank U Joey & it was mondo fuckin' Groovy seein' U again, & most of all, THANK U DIMITRIS 4 your set! I Loved it!

Yo Groovers, have a safe weekend & maybe I'll see some y'all around the was this weekend!


Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

--

From: Sean Casey <sean@cloudfactory.org>

Cc: brian@hyperreal.org

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Disposition: inline
User-Agent: Mutt/1.4i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] "Friendster" for mp3s???

So I was thinking it'd be kind of cool to have a secure peer-to-peer
filesharing service for linking groups of friends together.

It'd need a layer of encryption on every bit of the service. To
browse it, use it, eavesdrop on it, or even know what kind of
service is throwing around the encrypted packets, one would require
a key. That would be as simple as having a service admin, or perhaps
even a voting majority (pgp can do this) create you an access key.
One could even have an option of keeping the files encrypted on a
drive, and using a decryption driver to make them available to mp3
players on your box.

It'd be nice in many ways. People with similar interests would
naturally be able to help each other out more. It'd make it pretty
reasonable to advertise files without advertising them to the world.

It would utterly foil the RIAA.

Anyone know of anything like this? Or heard of it being developed?

Sean

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] "Friendster" for mp3s???

The voting thing is a tough problem. Some of what you're looking for can
probably be done with a system like Direct Connect
(http://www.neo-modus.com/), which lets you run your own server and
network. Just limit membership to people whose musical tastes you like. :)

Subject: [sfraves] Adobe Acquires Cool Edit Pro

--=====================_2160569==.ALT

Received the following from a friend.  I also understand Adobe will no 
longer offer Premiere for the Mac.


INTRODUCING ADOBE AUDITION!


Syntrillium Software and Adobe Systems Incorporated are delighted to announce
the introduction of AdobeR Audition(TM) software, the essential tool for
professional digital audio! Adobe Audition is a re-branded release of Cool Edit
Pro, which we expect to begin shipping in late August 2003.


Visit http://www.adobe.com/audition for more information.


Read on to learn how you can upgrade to Adobe Audition!


In May 2003, Adobe acquired the technology assets of Syntrillium Software,
including its flagship product, Cool Edit Pro. Adobe is excited about 
continuing
to develop Adobe Audition as the digital audio tool of choice for musicians,
audio professionals, and video professionals. Adobe Audition includes all 
of the
mixing, editing, mastering, effects, and analysis tools from Cool Edit Pro 2.1,
as well as thousands of royalty-free loops (including many from the Loopology
Web site). Integration with Adobe's video products has been added too.


As a customer, you have helped make Cool Edit a success. Your passion,
commitment, and enthusiasm-as well as your participation in the Cool Edit
community-will continue to be essential to our team. We hope that you'll 
upgrade
to Adobe Audition:


  Own Cool Edit Pro 2.x? You're eligible for a complimentary update to Adobe
Audition when it becomes available in late August! Visit
http://www.adobe.com/audition to find out when the product is available.


  Own Cool Edit 2000 or Cool Edit Pro 1.x? You can upgrade to Adobe 
Audition for
just $99(USD)! Just visit
http://www.adobe.com/store/products/master.jhtml?id=catAudition
to pre-order your copy today.


Upgrading entitles you to Adobe technical support, invitations to special Adobe
events, and more. We hope you'll join the Adobe family by upgrading to Adobe
Audition.


As part of Adobe's complete video solution, Adobe Audition is included in the
Adobe Video Collection, which also includes Adobe PremiereR Pro, Adobe After
EffectsR, and Adobe Encore(TM) DVD software. If you're looking to expand your
toolkit to include the most complete desktop video production solution
available, visit http://www.adobe.com/products/dvcoll to learn more about the
Adobe Video Collection.


Thanks for your support of Cool Edit, and we hope we can count on your future
support of Adobe Audition.


--The Cool Edit Pro/Adobe Audition team

Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio Tonight : Kirin, Abe Froman, and More :.

Hello my friends,

Yes, that's right, it's Sunday again.  And that means it's time for
another exciting episode of Dirtbox Radio.  Take a peek at this week's
special guests:

Kirin will be dropping in to start off tonight's show, from 7pm 'til
8:30pm EST, bringing along Final Scratch and tons of tunes.  For those of
you not lucky enough to catch him at the late Player's Ball in Bethesda
last month, be assured that he can throw down like a champ.

Abe Froman will be coming back to grace Dirtbox with his presence again
tonight.  He and his fellow crewmates are some of the hardest working
Junglists in the area right now, pumping out new CD's and crating around
some serious hotness.

Other guests for the night will be announced during the show, so make sure
to tune in, starting at 7pm EST, and running until Vindicut's Jungletrain
show @ 3am EST.  Big up the TX massif.

To tune in, go to http://www.dirtboxradio.com/listen.html, or click on one
of the following links.  Winamp is reccomended to tune in
(http://www.winamp.com).

64k - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls
webcam - http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html
chatroom - http://jungletrain.net/chat.htm

Feel free to hit us up on AIM as well, at DIRTBOXRADIO.

As always, we are continually looking for new talent to showcase.  If you
spin any style of dnb, hip-hop, or breaks, holla@dirtboxradio.com, and
we'll sort ya out.

The next few shows will be full takeovers from the A.L.I.A.S., Roundtable,
R3, Syndrome, and Mantis Sound crews.  More TBA.

Much love to all of you, and I hope to see you in the chatroom tonight.

Ez,
Jackson (ODJ)
Partners in Crime, Dirtbox Radio, Trividual Productions, A.L.I.A.S.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] ATP: NRR: Minidisc Players

--part1_161.23455a96.2c4bbcf2_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I used to use an RCA jack with the one black headphone size jack on the other 
end. I'd plug that end into where the computer speakers are supposed to go 
and then the RCA end into the minidisc player. What ever you're playing on your 
computer transfers onto the minidisc, you just hit record and then stop when 
the track is over, you do have to watch over it and hit record and stop at the 
perfect times but surprizingly the quality sounded great this way for me. You 
have to listen by putting headphones into the minidisc player as well by the 
way. You can even record stuff off of internet radio this way, it reminds me of 
the old days when we recorded blank tapes :)

--part1_161.23455a96.2c4bbcf2_boundary--

http://www.djunderground.com <http://www.djunderground.com/> .  I won't =
go
into too much detail, but it is a site geared towards electronic DJs and
Producers.

=20

If any of you would like to write articles for the site about your =
club/rave
trips, or electronic music-related articles, please give me a buzz.

=20

Come check it out!=20

=20

Patrick Masciocchi

DJUnderground.com

every 3rd Sunday of the Month at:
The Popi Lounge=20
3059 Hopyard Road
Pleasanton CA.=20

Join us this summer as enuriye productions has put together a Sunday =
experience that will be featuring weekly guest DJ's, 4-deck progressive =
battle sessions, and "FireLand" who will bring "fire-and-light" visual =
entertainment. For those who haven't experienced an enuriye gathering, =
this will entail some serious tribal/progressive madness starting @ 8 pm =
and continuing until we decide to stop. Join our family and experience =
what an awesome year it has been musically for our DJ's of this =
up-and-coming progressive collective.

Come out, enjoy some drinks from the overly stocked bar @ the Popi and =
catch a night of pulsating progressive anthems that will prepare you for =
the week ahead.

Subject: [sfraves] paradigm shifted

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit


massv respect to everybody that came out to paradigm shift. total respects to 
ALL the djs who worked so damned hard to keep the vibe alive. this, at a rave 
which some were saying it was the best they'd ever been to or said it was  
the most well done they'd seen in a really long while. 
       although way overbudget and coming out with a low return, i'd also 
have to say it was one of the best raves i'd ever been to. not simply because i 
held the reigns on this mission, but because this rave had everything i wanted 
a rave to have and that's worth eating a loss in my opinion. I think the vibe 
was also great due in part that there were lots of energy foods available 
(which made people less cranky) and caffeine was made free and at the ready. 
caffeine, i feel, has always been a great and reasonable alternative to turning 
your brain's neuro receptors into mush from illicit drug use. remember your older 
sister just taking no-doz and water to that beach party in 93?

respects to the Hated In Middleschool Crew:
Chel-c Faith our hostess
Shifty
Meter
Natatat
Kenneth J. Sexton
Navigator
and everybody who worked to make this party a reality. 

respects to
Everybody involved with DEF in it's goals and ideals, everybody who's 
furthering west coast techno in their own way, and bringing a positive attitude 
towards change in our small scene.

keep a sharp eye open for the DEFSF mob to rally back for another night of 
bangin' techno, smiles, and positivity in mid september.


-Sean
www.defsf.com


+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Subscribe to DEF Propaganda Mailing list. Techno news events and info.

to subscribe off site please send mail to:def-announce-request@defsf.com with 
the subject heading "subscribe" no message in the text body required.


--part1_7c.3b63cca4.2c4c6d01_boundary--

Subject: [sfraves] Paradigm Shift & NHC...Family Fun Sat

Wow... lastnight was sooooooo Dope!!! I mean... the eveng totally
started out @ a real Family (blood Family) party 'cause my cousin
like totally graduated from college (whhooop la la la) & so I had 2
hang w/ the relatives 4 a good hour! It was nice & Groovy seein'
them!! BUt I could none of my other cousins were like around & it was
all my Aunties & Uncles & I dunno... I totally had to get outta there
after like an hour of eating & stuff....LoL


So I went 2 Delia's & we yet embarked on another Saturday night
adventure!!! YAAAAAY!!


So we went 2 NHC 4 the last big shindig!! It was fun!! I mean...
oooooooh My Goodness... right away when I got there... it was total
family gathering!!! There were soooo many of U there & it was Dope!!!
I swear man... Brandon has fantaies of getting me in2 Bed or
something 'cause when he's drunk... LoL... oh... TMI!!! LoL... jk!!
LOLOLOLOLOLOLOLMAO... jk!! But I still kicked your ass when we
battled on the dancefloor!! Wow man... it was so neat!!!


Oh Yeah... Dymphna was spinning Jungle up there & she was busting out
some bad ass fuckin' hard shit & it was Dope!!! I was dancing my ass
off!! It was Sick!! Then another guy spun this Awesome Jungle set!!
WOW!!! Then after a while, this Dude came on & played this eeh...
Tribal Breakbeats with some salsa in it set!!! That was fun!


So after like an hour or so... I went over to Paradigm Shift!!!!
WOW!!! OK... that was soooooo Dope!!! OK... Another Family
gathering!!! It was the best!! I mean... the party itself was
Awesome!!! Free everything: water, red bull, food, 12 differents
coffee drinks, bubbble blowing stuff, candy, silly putty, footballs!!
Then there was a lil' Art Station where U could make name tags, &
pictures, Hello 2Day... it was neat!!


OK... but the music was soooooo sick!!! I got there when DJ Yap & DJ
Disconnect were spinning!!! WOW!!! It's the 1st time I think I saw a
Techno 2X4 like that!! So Dope!!! Right away when I got there... I
had 2 start dancing!!! Oh Oh Oh... I finally got 2 kick it w/ JBot,
Clarity, & Forest again after soooo many months!!! I Love them all!!!
Forest kept assuring me that she wasn't made @ me like I thought she
was 'cause she hasn't been returning my phone calls...La La La!! I
Love U Forest Baby!! & oh man... catchin' up w. JBot 4 that 5 minutes
we only got 2 C each other!! Love U Jbot!!! We gotta kick it soon
Homie! Enemy_Skies... you're an Asshole!!! LoL <3


The vibe was Neat there... I mean... every1 was in good spirits, I
met a new freindster "Spencer", & it was Dope!!!


OK... so Ed Colmar did his live PA Techno set & Wow... it was fun!!!
LoL... he was "riding the horse" again when he was don' his
live PA that I remember him doing last time I saw him perform!!!
Oooooooh man.. so good!!! I danced alot during this set!! I mean...
but after 45 minutes... I didn't hear the trash can song that he
played @ Mindcontrol... & as much fun as I was having @ Paradigm... I
kinda slipped out on the sly w/o sayin' anything 2 any1... LoL... &
went back 2 NHC 'cause I mean... I jus' had 2 B there... ya know!!


SO I was back @ NHC & they were still spinning breakbeats!!!
YUUUUUUM!! LoL... some guy went on during the night & put on some
Progressive House & people were buggin' that there was some1 spinning
that... but he mixed in some Bad Ass Breakbeat tracks along w/
that... so he's 4givin! LoL


But while I was there... DJ did the last set B4 I left!! Oooooh my
gosh man... he went all over w/ all that Jungle he was spinning!!!
YUMMMM!!! From Atmosperic to hard ass Evil shit... man... it was
totally hard 2 keep up! But I Loved it!


OK... is getting waaaaaay 2 long!! But it was Such a Dope night last
night!!! Thank U every1 I saw & I Love U all soooo much!!! Wow... I'm
in bliss

Subject: [sfraves] Jessica Grace Wing

I don't know how many of the people on this list have been around 
long enough to remember, but a beloved veteran of many a full moon 
rave has passed away.


============================
Jessica passed away Saturday, July 19th at home in Brooklyn. She was 
surrounded by family and loved ones.

We all deeply feel the loss of our talented, beautiful Jessica. It is 
incredibly difficult to comprehend losing one so young, vibrant and 
creative.

In addition to our thoughts and memories of the time we spent with 
her, she has given us music that will live on.

Her last project, into which she put a significant amount of time and 
creative energy as Jessica has always done, is a new opera entitled 
"Lost," a collaborative effort with playwright Kirk Wood Bromley. 
Jessica composed the opera's original score.

"Lost" is scheduled to open on August 9th as part of NYC's celebrated 
Fringe Festival

More information and a sampling of songs can be found here:
http://www.inversetheater.org/Productions/lost/info.htm
http://warmblooded.com/
+
http://justified.com/

Please come to the show, and please download and listen to Jess's 
music, and pass it on to friends. As you know, that is what she would 
have wanted.

If you'd like to send your condolences to the family, the address is:
260 Hoyt Street
Brooklyn, NY  11217

Please forward this message to all who knew her and loved her.
===========================
-- 
Simon Gatrall
gatrall@pacbell.net

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
