AndyW <andy@saturn5.com> wrote:

On Wed, 23 Jul 2003, Coolworld wrote:
-&e->Actually omid, no ones trying to sweep anything under the rug here,
-&e->simply trying not to over sensationalize something that is in a
-&e->difference in opinion, both professionally and personally.

You guys are being upfront well before the show, so that's cool in my
book.

-&e-> I think 10 threads is pretty sufficient?

Whatever it takes. The larger your promotion and party... the larger the
discussion. The more you promise the world, the more a natural increase
in skepticism. You guys signed up for the big time, not me. I could get
mad (about the fact that my last car's window derailed from how hard one
of your flyer peeps shoved your foldout into my window jam but I'm over it
now even thought I wasn't even parked anywhere near a club or party at the
time).

-&e-> I admire your persistence and need to make sure Coolworld presents
-&e->an honest depiction of it's event, so i simply asked you to take it
-&e->on a private level.

Asking questions publicly to the benefit of the public as a response to a
public advertisment is totally fair game. this is not an advertisement
list, it's a discussion list, so expect a little discussion in return for
the free promotion opportunity.

And it's a great topic this Kraftwerk thing... I mean, just WHO is the
operator of my pocket calculator?

peace,
andyw

p.s. You haven't gotten back to me about booking me for your party, which
lands on my birthday (what a coincendence, the premier West Coast Massive
and my being shot forth into the world by my loving mum... is that cool or
what!?!?!).. so I'll remind you of my special needs on my special day.
They are as follows: I need three decks, and a good mixer (I reserve the
right to adjust the turntables to span a bigger bpm range, but I'll set
them back when I'm done so it's shouldn't be a problem). I'd like to play
on the loudest sound system there (I love it when the bass rattles my
nuts, it feels like a friendly musical hand). Furthermore, if I could
play after some big name DJ and wipe the floor with their over-marketed
ass, that would be great... maybe Christopher Lawrence, last time I played
after him was super fun (few years back at one of the Innercense
parties... right after his wedding actually, suffice to say his hair
looked great! I'd love to figure out who his stylist is, I've got some
problems managing my locks if you know what I mean). I'd also like a cold
six pack of Coors Light or Lucky Lager, a blunt and some nice people to
pass it around with (this has to be _before_ my set, it helps me unwind
and feel *the vibe*), and if possible an armed escort so I can get back to
my bike safely with all the grip I'm gonna make for the set I'm playing
for you guys. If you guys wanna really set me up, I like those almond
m&m's... don't worry about hiring any dancing girls or anything, my beats
take care of that right quick (the honeys like a friendly musical hand too
*wink wink*). You don't need to worry about a hotel (I'm local baby!),
and I know of at least three people that aren't planning on going that
would totally go if you booked me (so that's like a third of what you'd
need to pay me right there!). So it's like a win/win situation! Act now!
I know I play techno and you might have your doubts, but seriously, it's
the shinny (and well, Carl Cox and Jeff Mills are techno Djs too,
right?!)! Plus, I'm sorta considered underground, imagine the value add
of all the 'street cred' I pack in this ass... it's like you could
promote your party as a *Genuine* Underground Event[tm] like Vlad used to
when he'd book me for those 5am chill room slots. In fact, it's okay if
you want to use my name to help sell it... like maybe CYBERFEST featuring
ANDYW (please note capitalization... all text should appear in like
fontface and size although dropping the point on the "featuring" is
acceptable if called for by formatting constraints). If you wanna drop
the Kraftwerk guy, I could dress up kinda nerdy and open up my set with
Tour de France as well (you 'd save a ton of money, I could totally pass
for a German electronic music pioneer, and I won't tell if you won't ;).
Please get back to me when you have a chance, it's getting kinda tough to
keep this date open (the Canadian Government narrowly voted against adding
AndyW Day to their holiday calendar last session, but apparently
detractors of the measure felt they had to repeal Bastille Day first...
and I don't want to sit in some silly car cruising at 3 kilometers per
hour in some parade in Quebec anyways, casue you know... I don't even
speak French!). In any case, I'm really looking foward to it! Peace
dudes!

i am not a lesbian, but even if i were, i would still not be into some random lesbian coming up to me because they think the environment is safe or because my gay husband sent her over to me to create some sort of fantasy come to life for her or for a potential crowd of strangers. i wish people would learn to keep their hands to themselves. i don't think that sexual orientation is sexy. sexual orientation just is. i am not into experimenting with people and judging them based on the results or anything like that. i think that is so weird and just so annoying beyond belief, so i just treat it like trying to buy some groceries. no matter where you are, or might always have to take a huge round about route until the lameness either changes or goes away completely, which usually it doesn't, so really, it is not about words as it is about convenience for a lot of people. why do you think people fly from coast to coast for the simplicities? really, consider it.

> to say his hair
> looked great! I'd love to figure out who his stylist
> is, I've got some
> problems managing my locks if you know what I mean).

> six pack of Coors Light or Lucky Lager, a blunt and
> some nice people to
> pass it around with (this has to be _before_ my set,
> it helps me unwind
> and feel *the vibe*), and if possible an armed
> escort so I can get back to
> my bike safely with all the grip I'm gonna make for
> the set I'm playing
> for you guys. If you guys wanna really set me up, I
> like those almond
> m&m's... don't worry about hiring any dancing girls
> or anything, my beats
> take care of that right quick (the honeys like a
> friendly musical hand too
> *wink wink*). You don't need to worry about a hotel
> (I'm local baby!),
> and I know of at least three people that aren't
> planning on going that
> would totally go if you booked me (so that's like a
> third of what you'd
> need to pay me right there!). So it's like a win/win
> situation! Act now!

> but seriously, it's
> the shinny (and well, Carl Cox and Jeff Mills are
> techno Djs too,
> right?!)! Plus, I'm sorta considered underground,
> imagine the value add
> of all the 'street cred' I pack in this ass... it's
> like you could
> promote your party as a *Genuine* Underground
> Event[tm] like Vlad used to
> when he'd book me for those 5am chill room slots. In
> fact, it's okay if
> you want to use my name to help sell it... like
> maybe CYBERFEST featuring
> ANDYW (please note capitalization... all text should

> fontface and size although dropping the point on the

> acceptable if called for by formatting constraints).

** :CODE RED: 

** ALERT -> :CODE regrets to announce that T-1000 will not be 
   playing, due to illness.  We all hope he gets better soon!  
   In place of T-1000, we present Richard and Melanie 
   Summerhayes, the husband and wife team behind Eukatech
   records!

** :CODE -> transmission continuing 

** :CODE -> Help us celebrate TWO YEARS of :CODE!!!
          || http://code.dnalounge.com
          || http://www.dnalounge.com/flyers/2003/07/10-code.html
          || displaying :CODE sequence for 07.24.03:

** :CODE has been around for two years now, providing SF with some
   of the best in local and international electronic music talent.
   To help us celebrate our success, we've got a lot of neat stuff
   lined up for the night, including art displays and taping for
   the next episode of :CODETV!

THE MAIN ROOM:
+--------------------------------------------------------------
| Richard Summerhayes  [ Eukatech / Energy Industries / TT500 ]
| DJ Melanie                             [ Macumba / Eukatech ]
| Praxis --live PA               [ Omniscient Records / :CODE ]
| Shank                    [ :CODE / Epiphany / Cloud Factory ]
| Amber                                   [ :CODE / Sister SF ]
|   -vs-
| Dragn'fly                             [ Epiphany / Teknique ]
|    (2x4 -- on four turntables)


THE LOUNGE (hosted by Sleeveless, SF and judah. skateboards):
+--------------------------------------------------------------
| Aye-n vs. Ivry                                [ Compression ]
| UltraViolet             [ Sleeveless, Future Breaks, judah. ]
| Femmes Fetales          [ Sleeveless, Future Breaks, judah. ]
| Arson                          [ Urban Drums, Triple 5 Soul ]


Live webcasting with separate audio and video feeds
---+-----------------------------------------------------------
   | http://www.dnalounge.com/audio
   | http://www.dnalounge.com/cam


:CODE || techno. electro. drum-n-bass. breaks.

   | free before 10pm. $5 after.

Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] ESTUARY :: Mon July 28 :: Sheztek (Moksha Tribe)

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii


Estuary :: Open Deck Weekly 

Monday July 28, 2003
9:00 pm - 2:00 am 
Masse's Nightclub :: 21+ w/ID, Free
Weekly Guest :: Sheztek (Moksha Tribe)

Estuary :: (Noun) 1. Where the river blends with the sea. 2. A place where all styles mix.

Every Monday from 9pm-11:30pm and 12:30pm-2am we will have 1/2 hour open deck slots. Sign ups 8:30pm-9pm, first come first served! Come early!! These slots go quickly! If you have no skills at all, but have some cool tracks that you'd like to share, you are just as welcome as anyone else! ***Please bring needles and headphones.***

EGP is gearing up for Jagan and we want to give all you lovely people a taste of what is to come...

Our Featured Guest this week is Sheztek from Moksha Tribe! He kicked ass last week on the open decks, so we just had to bring him back this week! Check him out at 11:30pm.

Added bonuses:
$2 STRONG Islands
FREE pool tables
Outdoor smoking patio
NO COVER CHARGE!!! WOOHOO!!
21+ up w/ ID, please

Masse's Nightclub
6180 Stoneridge Mall Drive 
Pleasanton, CA 
(650) 463-8181

Jagan tix are available here. See Jessica.

***Brought to you by Happy/Devil and EGP. You down wit EGP??***

First of all, I have to say that I can appreciate the intention of protecting ourselves here...

However, I also feel obligated to say that if this is anything more than a passing joke it is 1.) a gross violation of privacy and 2.) opens whoever is maintaining it to libel/slander suits.

If indeed this is more than a joke, I wouldn't feel too sorry for anyone that DID get sued.  Managing personal STD infections are the responsibility of that individual; NOT the community, and certainly not via a cruel and embarassing blacklist.  It's kinda like the stocks in the puritan colonies.

Just my 2 condoms worth...

- Graham

FYI - my CLEAN, RECENT test reports are available should the ladies of SFR have any questions.  ;)

Hey all-

 who has slept with who.

keeping track of the STD chain becomes a very
important thing.  STDs are real, and it's important
everyone be informed and knowledgable about everyone
here.

There's only about 20 names on it so far, and it's not
complete by any means so please send me any
information you have about anyone here and I'll add
them to the list.

techs some other way.

fun practicing and playin with them.  I mean, I wouldnt even be able to buy 
final scratch for a long time but I dont have problems with practicing with 
regular records and what not.  Yeesh, I will be just barely scraping by 
financially if I buy these tables.

OK... so we go over 2 the meZzanine & theres like these signs on the wall that say strobe lights in use, and i was like, yeah like maybe i will have a seizure, Hello 2Day! but the strobes in there, oooooooh my gOsh, like i have retinal burn 4ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!

OK... but Hello 2Day!!! Squarepusher came on & ooooooh man, it was like oh my gOsh!!! First of all, I have to say that I can appreciate the intention of
protecting ourselves here...

a passing joke it is 1.) a gross violation of privacy and 2.) opens
whoever is maintaining it to libel/slander suits.

that DID get sued.  Managing personal STD infections are the
responsibility of that individual; NOT the community, and certainly not
via a cruel and embarassing blacklist.  It's kinda like the stocks in
the puritan colonies.

Just my 2 condoms worth...

- Graham

From: Giles Bowkett <giles_bowkett@yahoo.com>

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves]NRR: FLustered over Technics

you'll need to spend money on records to even use the
turntables. put aside half the money for turntables,
use the cash left over to make life fun, and then save
up the difference.

making life fun includes buying records. :-)

or, since you want to learn turntablism, buy one
turntable and a mixer. a lot of turntablist techniques
only require one table and a mixer to learn. the idea
is, the first record spins unmolested on the 1s, while
the other record is scratched, crabbed, transformed,
and flibberdigibbetted to hell and back on the 2s. you
might not be able to put on any parties with just one
table and a mixer, but you'll be able to learn shit,
and there's no point putting on a party until you know
what you're doing anyway. :-)

but really, ignore all that, just buy the fucking
tables. food and rent are for pussies.


Giles

At 11:16 PM 7/23/2003 -0700, Giles Bowkett wrote:
>--- shawn allen <shawn@alterior.net> wrote:
> > Breakup drama doesn't usually last
> > 11 years, right?
>
>I sure hope not...
>
> > But you're right in some respects, this is starting
> > to sound like a
> > legal issue. Did Karl get booked as Kraftwerk (with
> > the band's
> > permission), or is Coolworld just using his
> > involvement with the group
> > to sell tickets?
>
>story...
>
>my favorite band in high school was Sisters of Mercy.
>Sisters of Mercy got involved in litigation pretty
>regularly -- basically, any time the main guy (Andrew
>Eldritch) disagreed with anyone else in the band, he
>kicked them out, sued them, and (in extreme cases)
>made records bragging about the amount of money they
>had to pay him to settle the lawsuits.
>
>as you could imagine he had a different guitarist
>every album. he also had a different bassist every
>album. in fact the only member of the band to stick
>thru it the whole time besides Eldritch himself was
>Doktor Avalanche, his trusty drum machine.
>
>Eldritch/SOM recently toured the states playing a ton
>of unreleased material which was not available
>anywhere else. he hadn't put out a new album for
>several years, because he was busy suing his record
>label over the terms of its recording and release.
>
>anyway, during the few years I was all into this goth
>stuff, I learnt the history of the band, and this sort
>of thing is **exactly** what used to happen right
>before Eldritch sued somebody.
>
>however, Andrew Eldritch is definitely eccentric.
>
>hopefully the guys from Kraftwerk are a little more
>laid back.
>
> > Regardless, the man was one of the most influential
> > members of the group
> > during their most prolific period. He had a hand in
> > most of the tracks
> > that originally defined techno as a musical genre,
> > ideology, and
> > cultural movement. So, if you're really interested
> > in seeing your
> > favorite Kraftwerk tracks performed live by one of
> > the "godfathers of
> > techno", you should still at least consider going.
> > ;)
>
>altho in all fairness Kraftwerk more inspired techno
>than defined it...you know what would be cool? a mix
>CD which combined Kraftwerk, Africa Bambatta, World
>Class Wrecking Cru, Juan Atkins, etc., and sort of put
>them all in historical context -- so you could hear
>how the ideas flowed from track to track. put in early
>house, too, kz all the Detroit guys were driving to
>Chicago to buy records.
>
>man that would be cool to hear.
>
>which reminds me, I gotta get that Tenaglia mix
>"Classics."
>
>blah, blah... :-)
>
>
>Giles

> > > legal issue. Did Karl get booked as Kraftwerk (with
> > > the band's
> > > permission), or is Coolworld just using his
> > > involvement with the group
> > > to sell tickets?
> >
> >story...
> >
> >my favorite band in high school was Sisters of Mercy.
> >Sisters of Mercy got involved in litigation pretty
> >regularly -- basically, any time the main guy (Andrew
> >Eldritch) disagreed with anyone else in the band, he
> >kicked them out, sued them, and (in extreme cases)
> >made records bragging about the amount of money they
> >had to pay him to settle the lawsuits.
> >
> >as you could imagine he had a different guitarist
> >every album. he also had a different bassist every
> >album. in fact the only member of the band to stick
> >thru it the whole time besides Eldritch himself was
> >Doktor Avalanche, his trusty drum machine.
> >
> >Eldritch/SOM recently toured the states playing a ton
> >of unreleased material which was not available
> >anywhere else. he hadn't put out a new album for
> >several years, because he was busy suing his record
> >label over the terms of its recording and release.
> >
> >anyway, during the few years I was all into this goth
> >stuff, I learnt the history of the band, and this sort
> >of thing is **exactly** what used to happen right
> >before Eldritch sued somebody.
> >
> >however, Andrew Eldritch is definitely eccentric.
> >
> >hopefully the guys from Kraftwerk are a little more
> >laid back.

> > > members of the group

Subject: [sfraves] BSP update: Rendezvous, Aug. 2, will be in San Leandro

Hi everyone, after I posted some info about Rendezvous, people started asking me where the party was going to be. Istyly has announced that it's going to be in San Leandro, just south of Oakland. A virgin venue, no less! The party is permitted, all ages, and will go from 6 pm to 2 am. (The actual location will be be given out at 9 am the day of the party -- Saturday, August 2.) San Leandro is easily accessible from the 880 freeway.

If you didn't already hear, ticket prices have been reduced to $9.00. Tickets at the door will be $15.00. Rest assured, it isn't because of a smaller venue or fewer DJs -- Istyly just managed to get a better deal on this great venue. The pre-sale outlets will have the new price today. 

We're looking forward to seeing everyone at this party for the return of Istyly. Thanks, everyone -- have a safe, wonderful, and fun time.

Again, here is the info on the party:
Istyly is back kids!!  And we are ready to throw another party for you all!!  Banging the Bass in ROOM ONE : Tom Slick, Mystre,  Thee-o,  Denise,  Ton:e,  Molly Mush,  Peter Gozenya vs Yagi,  & Lip. Bringing the Beats in ROOM TWO:   Torque,  EJthaDJ,  Little Star,  DJ Citrik,  Charlie,  Dj Girlie, & Carlos Alfonso. All responsible ages are welcome to join our happy celebration. Infoline 415.820.1649 / 510.496.6065.

Camp LiteBrite Presents: Starliite Starbrite - Fundraiser Thurs. July  
31st

Dreams and reality are separated by the thinnest of walls.  Dream hard
enough, and it can transform your reality. Come dream with us, on our
fabulous Giant LiteBrite.  Create your dreams in colors and lights, and  
see
it come true. Paint the universe with your dreams, your wishes and our
Giant LiteBrite. Let the stars of the night guide you to a place both
wonderful and joyous... Come and show the world your creative spirit.  
It's
time to play.

Join us for an evening of bright stars and bright lights, music and
merriment, the wondrous LiteBrite Hottie Auction, flaming variety acts  
and
more. Oh yeah, and dance your arse off! Camp LiteBrite wishes to bring  
the
Giant LiteBrite back to Burning Man this year, but only with your help  
can
she return in all her glory!

What: Camp Lite Brite's Burning Man Fundraiser
When: Thursday, July 31st 2003, 9p.m. until 2a.m.
Where: Rawhide, 280 7th Street, San Francisco

http://www.mapquest.com/maps/ 
map.adp?country=US&size=big&address=280+7th+Street&city=San+Francisco&st 
ate=CA

Who: You and all your 21+ friends (w/ID at the door, please)
How Much: Tickets $11 advance (via Paypal), $15 door -
http://www.litebrite.org/tickets
Why: Help us bring the Giant Lite Brite back to the playa in all her  
glory
and grandeur and to dance your ass off.

DJ's :
Scott Carrelli
http://www.electrocelt.com/artists/scottcarelli.htm
  - Progressive house, deep house, electro and techno

http://www.relaxmusic.tv/djbios/djsmoove.html
- Drum n Bass, break beat, Electro

DJ Kit (Midian & SIN) and Jim Yu (Solesystem/Flow)
  - Providing sensory overload for your mind and body in our chill space

All The Extra Fun Stuff:
Live Auction with the Vicar of Liquor
- Preview of live and silent auction items
(http://www.litebrite.org/tickets/auction.html)
- Your chance to bid on your favorite LiteBrite Hotties

Massage and other Sensory Pleasures
- Pamper yourself in the Cool Blue Chill Room

- http://www.firepixie.com/fire

Guild/Thunderdome, at

Subject: [sfraves] NRR Some Friday humor

Understanding Engineers - Take One



Two engineering students were walking across the campus when one said, 
"Where did you get such a great bike?"



The second engineer replied, "Well, I was walking along yesterday
minding my 
own business when a beautiful woman rode up on this bike. She threw the
bike 
to the ground, took off all her clothes and said, "Take what you want."



The second engineer nodded approvingly, "Good choice; the clothes
probably 
wouldn't have fit."




Understanding Engineers - Take Two



To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is
half 
empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.




Understanding Engineers - Take Three



A priest, a doctor and an engineer were waiting one morning for a 
particularly slow group of golfers.



The engineer fumed, "What's with these people? We've been waiting for 15

minutes!"



The doctor chimed in, "I don't know, but I've never seen such
ineptitude!"



The priest said, "Hey, here comes the green keeper. Let's have a word
with 
him." "Hi George, what's the matter that group ahead of us? They're
rather 
slow, aren't they?"



The green keeper replied, "Oh, yes, that's a group of blind
fire-fighters. They lost their sight saving our clubhouse from a fire
last 
year, so we always let them play for free anytime."



The group was silent for a moment.



Then the priest said, "That's so sad. I think I will say a special
prayer for them tonight."



The doctor said, "Good idea. And I'm going to contact my ophthalmologist

friend and see if there is anything he can do for them."



The engineer said, "Why can't they play at night?"





Understanding Engineers - Take Four



A man in a hot air balloon realized he was lost. He reduced altitude and

spotted a woman below. He descended a bit more and shouted, "Excuse me,
can 
you help me? I promised a friend I would meet him an hour ago, but I
don't 
know where I am."



The woman below replied, "You are in a hot air balloon hovering 
approximately 30 feet above the ground. You are between 40 and 41
degrees 
north latitude and between 59 and 60 degrees west longitude."



"You must be an engineer," said the balloonist.



"I am," replied the woman, "How did you know?"



"Well," answered the balloonist, "everything you told me is, technically

correct, but I have no idea what to make of your information, and the
fact 
is I am still lost. Frankly, you've not been much help so far."



The woman below responded, "You must be in Management."



"I am," replied the balloonist, "but how did you know?"



"Well," said the woman, "you don't know where you are or where you are 
going. You have risen to where you are due to a large quantity of hot
air. 
You made a promise, which you have no idea how to keep, and you expect 
people beneath you to solve your problems. The fact is you are in
exactly the same position you were in before we met, but now, somehow,
it's 
my fault."





Understanding Engineers - Take Five



What is the difference between Mechanical Engineers and Civil Engineers?



Mechanical Engineers build weapons. Civil Engineers build targets.





Understanding Engineers - Take Six



Normal people ... believe that if it isn't broken, don't fix it.
Engineers believe that if it isn't broken, it doesn't have enough
features 
yet.





Understanding Engineers - Take Seven



An architect, an artist and an engineer were discussing whether it was 
better to spend time with the wife or a mistress.



The architect said he enjoyed time with his wife, building a solid 
foundation for an enduring relationship.



The artist said he enjoyed time with his mistress, because of the
passion 
and mystery he found there.



The engineer said, "I like both."



"Both?" Replied the architect and artist.



"Yeah. If you have a wife and a mistress, they will each assume you are 
spending time with the other woman, and you can go to the lab and get
some 
work done."




Understanding Engineers - Take Eight



One day, an engineer was crossing a road when a frog called out to him
and 
said, "If you kiss me, I'll turn into a beautiful princess".



He bent over, picked up the frog and put it in his pocket.



The frog spoke up again and said, "If you kiss me and turn me back into
a 
beautiful princess, I will stay with you for one week."



The engineer took the frog out of his pocket, smiled at it and returned
it 
to the pocket.



The frog then cried out, "If you kiss me and turn me back into a
princess, 
I'll stay with you and do ANYTHING you want."



Again the engineer took the frog out, smiled at it and put it back into
his 
pocket.



Finally, the frog asked, "What is the matter? I've told you I'm a
beautiful 
princess, I'll stay with you for a week and do anything you want. Why
won't 
you kiss me?"



The engineer said, "Look. I'm an engineer. I don't have time for a 
girlfriend, but a talking frog, now that's cool."

Jason Philips
Compos-Mentis
Problematic Beats

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Maxim Party Review

Well I have to say that our sfr sources of what to expect for this party 
were right on.. lot's of plastic (silicone actually), and lots and lots and 
LOTS of eye candy.  If you could say.. lets throw a party and invite the 
most beautiful people we know.. hire a dj that spins hiphop and sandstorm.. 
for those people ;-), oh.. and of course, it's all for a bud light superbowl 
commercial.. then that's what I just experienced.  I have to say, the 8 or 
so dancers they hired were fabulous looking.. amazing stage presence and not 
too shabby with the moves either.  They filmed people all night long, with 
busy cameramen running around with strange audio gear and wireless movie 
cams.. gettin in peoples faces and broadcasting it on these huge screens and 
plasma monitors everywhere.. and the one thing I kept thinking as I watched 
was.. she's hot.. oh.. and the other was.. she want's to be a model.  
Everybody there was like- ooh.. a camera is filming me.. I must be sexy and 
devastatingly provocative as if my career depended on it.. LMAO!!  Seeing 
these people try to make the commercial was beyond belief.. and if bud light 
actually used any of the footage.. I would be kinda appalled.. but that's 
why I don't drink bud light anyway.. oh and because its sux ass.

Well, we were on the inside.. it was sweet.. limo in the front.. pimpin like 
big G's..hehe. My bro's friend was one of the promoters.. after being there 
5 minutes, they invited us to do a shot in the limo.. about 12 people piled 
in.. it was huge.  Then the cameras started to flash.. every damn person in 
this car looked like they were straight out of a las vegas strip club (not 
that I know what that looks like but if I could imagine.. this would be 
it).. the women were smokin.. the guys were all gettin their swerve on.. and 
I was in a state of disbelief.  Do you ever look at something your doing an 
feel like it's kinda surreal?  Well that was my whole night!

On a positive note.. If ever you have the chance to party at the 1300 Van 
Ness location.. I think its called the Regency Center.. do it!  It is one of 
the nicest venues I have been too.. super central.. lots of activity.. great 
location.. can get loud as hell and no one would care or notice from 
outside.  Beautiful bar in the center, a huge balcony with bleachers top 
side.. a big stage up high in front.. and lots of Corinthian style pillars 
and awnings, red hanging velvet and tapastries.. all very kewl.  I highly 
recommend ( promoters.. nudge nudge)!

Watch for me at superbowl halftime :)

SFR: Ranger
Santa Cruz
plurranger@hotmail.com

Subject: [sfraves] BayFF Digital Mix - TONIGHT

* Digital Mix: A Special BayFF Celebrating Illegal Art

On July 25, the Electronic Frontier Foundation will host a night of music,
art, and conversation to celebrate digital culture.  Hosted at the Black
Box in downtown Oakland, this special BayFF will bring up-and-coming
artists of electronica, digital film, and illegal art together with leaders
from the cyber-rights movement.  Lawsuits and legislation have become the
weapons of choice for dealing with file-sharing and cultural recycling
("sampling"); come out and discover what all the hype is about. Between
laptop music, hip hop, and industrial performances, you will hear from
people who are fighting to protect new forms of expression and cultural
distribution from the attacks of the entertainment industry.  This is an
all-ages event.

Performers:
   ~ Cat Five <http://www.katfive.com/>
   ~ Meanest Man Contest <http://www.weapon-shaped.com/mmc/>
   ~ Uprock <http://www.kelpandcircuits.com>
   ~ Mochipet <http://www.mochipet.com>
   ~ Freshblend <http://www.freshblend.com>

Speakers:
   ~ Fred von Lohmann (Electronic Frontier Foundation) <http://www.eff.org>
   ~ Glenn Otis Brown (Creative Commons) <http://www.creativecommons.org>
   ~ Ray Beldner (Stay Free's Illegal Art Exhibit) <http://www.illegal-art.org>

Sponsored By:
   ~ XLR8R Magazine <http://www.xlr8r.com>

Where:  Black Box at 1928 Telegraph Avenue
         Oakland, CA <http://blackboxoakland.com>
When:  Friday, July 25th, 8 p.m. - 2 a.m.
Cost: $5 suggested donation
All ages welcome
Easy BART access @ 19th St. Station in Oakland
Directions available here:
   <http://blackboxoakland.com/directions/directions.htm>
For more information:
http://www.eff.org  (text announcement)
http://www.eff.org/digitalmix (poster)
Contact:
katina@eff.org

when i have ten dollars...extra...i'm tempted to run to clement street and pick up a mini-accordion at the music shop...or ... i hear the startup of a boeing jet engine ... it's 10 bucks towards that round the world plane ticket...only $3-- to go...every little bit helps.  i usually have fun for free...so that $10 helps me get on that plane

Geri Dahl <eeelips@yahoo.com> wrote:when i have ten dollars, i usually will eat something, go somewhere fun, buy something to wear, a new scent, some new lipstick, go to a place where i can dance with as little bothering as possible...the last thing i would do is go somewhere to visit someone i don't want to see. i can't believe anyone would think even for one instance that i would go to visit someone that i am not at all interested in. i also can't believe that someone would ever think that i would be as immature as they need me to be just based on their own hypnotic suggestion. anyway, i know how to have real fun with ten dollars and it has never involved hanging out with some jerk or some jerks. :)

hey everyone
 
i'm doing inventory for a company called DVD station, and i  wanted 
to buy the Intellect DVD for our inventory...but i'm not fully in 
charge of that...i need to know now many of you would rent the film from us 
if we bought it.  we're located in the Metreon in San Francisco, on the 
first floor.  it's this semi-automated deal where you put in your 
credit card, push some touch screen buttons and order it...it prints a 
receipt you turn to the counter and the dude gets your movies.  $1/day for 
as long as you have the movie out (have it out for 2 weeks, it's $14 )  
enough positive responses for the list and maybe i can persuade the 
dudes to buy it...we also have another branch at royal grounds cafe in the 
fillmore, but the metreon would probably be the location they'd put 
this film...
 
so would you rent it?
 
i know...sucked into the souless corporate world..don't get me 
started...it pays the rent...and my plane tickets...
 
cheers,
 
lauren

--- miss g <rhythmzslave@yahoo.com> wrote:
> hey everyone
>  
> i'm doing inventory for a company called DVD station, and i  wanted 
> to buy the Intellect DVD for our inventory...but i'm not fully in 
> charge of that...i need to know now many of you would rent the film from us 
> if we bought it.  we're located in the Metreon in San Francisco, on the 
> first floor.  it's this semi-automated deal where you put in your 
> credit card, push some touch screen buttons and order it...it prints a 
> receipt you turn to the counter and the dude gets your movies.  $1/day for 
> as long as you have the movie out (have it out for 2 weeks, it's $14 )  
> enough positive responses for the list and maybe i can persuade the 
> dudes to buy it...we also have another branch at royal grounds cafe in the 
> fillmore, but the metreon would probably be the location they'd put 
> this film...
>  
> so would you rent it?

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 25 Jul 2003 20:48:58.0643 (UTC) FILETIME=[2BC37630:01C352EE]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 900/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP :: AEC :: RAWR! :: **TONIGHT!** :: FREE :: 12am - 6am :: outdoor

Tonight is the night! AEC is back again with another party in the great
outdoors. In celebration of all the leo birthdays out there we're going to
be taking you back to when all house//trance//breaks//dnb was *rave* music
and the hard lines drawn between the genres hadn't formed yet. It's a
special night where all of the dj's will be playing genres they used to
play, but no longer do. It's a re.re.re.wind night under the stars. Get
stupid silly and run around as your alter ego with the rest of the clan
tonight. We're going back to the same location as AEC :: Come As You Aren't
from 2 years ago. The spot is nestled in a secret valley where you can drive
into the location. Hear you local DJ favorites play music as their alter
egos! Bring a friend whether that be you neighbor, your classmate or that
cute barista that just hooked you up with a tripple venti caramel macciato
then licked their lips and smiled at you.

Check your seriousness at the door. Turn your goof on and come ready to
throw down silly style!

// Info line will be announced by *5pm* and updated at 11:30pm tonight! //

This is word of mouth from here on out. If you miss the email with the vm #
just ask around for it!

:: RULES ::
!! YOU MUST FOLLOW THEM!!
Go the speed limit and don't pass other cars.
A carload of *ravers* sticks out so please keep the sound systems turned
down as well.
If you see someone behind you or coming towards you on the road keep going
past the gate.
Make a mental note as to where the gate is and keep driving past it.
Turn around up the road a bit and wait for the car to pass so as not to draw
attention to the location.
Be patient if there happens to be traffic do not just head for the gate
anyway! The party goes all night with cooperation.
When you're alone on the road turn into the gate and someone will open it
for you. TURN OFF ALL LIGHTS.
Go SLOWLY through the gate and continue slowly up the hill and please DO NOT
use your brakes (break lights come on)
Once you have crested the hill there will be someone to direct you to
parking.
We ask that once you are at the party that you do not try to leave until
after 4am. Having cars going in and out of the space puts the entire party
at risk.
Keep flashlights low so that you don't light up the hillsides for road
traffic to see.
Do NOT wander up to the top of the hill at night. You are visible from the
road up there and especially with glowsticks or other lighted objects
There is heavy equipment in the area and although hot rodding it would be
fun, we ask that you leave it alone.
LEAVE NO TRACE - No garbage, cigarette butts, flyers, cans, bottles, etc


:: DJ.s :: (...as their alter egos..) ::
sTiCk.E.bOi (michael the red stickman)
tEKn0.LuV.bUnN.E (andy w)
tRaNc.E.pAnTs.E. (tyler adams//dirtweed)
hAloN (justin hale)
Dr.Ew (andrew phelan)
LiL.niKkI (nick wilson)
lu5hIoUs.LaNe (marshal.lane//swatsound)
lil.bUnN.E.FoOfOo (jason wall//whiterabbit//dk)

aec.iNFO ::
Friday July, 25th 2003
12:00am - 06:00am
Located 20 minutes from Berkeley in the EastBay
Total UV immersion. glo.baby.glo
Sound :: SWATSound :: www.swatsound.com

This sucka is free and sucka free

cOnTaCT ::

aeclubsyou@hotmal.com

aec.lubs.u! =)

funny...



> > Sent: 25 July 2003 11:36
> > Subject: Misquotes
> >
> >
> > ABSOLUTE QUALITY.
> >
> >
> > Some of the finest double entendres on British TV & Radio in recent
> > years:
> >
> >
> > MICHAEL Buerk watching Phillipa Forrester cuddle up to a male
> > astronomer for warmth during BBC1's UK eclipse coverage remarked: =
"They
> > seem cold out there, they're rubbing each other and he's only come =
in
> > his shorts."
> >
> > KEN Brown commentating on golfer Nick Faldo and his caddie Fanny
> > Sunneson lining-up shots at the Scottish Open: "Some weeks Nick =
likes to
> > use Fanny, other weeks he prefers to do it by himself."
> >
> > MIKE Hallett discussing missed snooker shots on Sky Sports: "Stephen
> > Hendry jumps on Steve Davis's misses every chance he gets."
> >
> > JACK Burnicle was talking about Colin Edwards' tyre choice on World
> > Superbike racing: "Colin had a hard on in practice earlier, and I =
bet
> > He wished he had a hard on now."
> >
> > CHRIS Tarrant discussing the first Millionaire winner Judith Keppel =
on
> > This Morning: "She was practising fastest finger first by herself in =
bed
> > Last night."
> >
> > WINNING Post's Stewart Machin commentating on jockey Tony McCoy's
> > Formidable lead: "Tony has a quick look between his legs and likes =
what
> > he sees."
> >
> > ROSS King discussing relays with champion runner Phil Redmond: "Well
> > Phil, tell us about your amazing third leg."
> >
> > CRICKETER Neil Fairbrother hit a single during a Durham v Lancashire
> > match, inspiring Bobby Simpson to observe: "With his lovely soft =
hands
> > he just tossed it off."
> >
> > CLAIR Frisby talking about a jumbo hot dog on Look North said: =
"There's
> > nothing like a big hot sausage inside you on a cold night like =
this."
> >
> > JAMES Allen interviewing Ralf Schumacher at a Grand Prix, asked: =
"What
> > Does it feel like being rammed up the backside by Barrichello?"
> >
> > STEVE Ryder covering the US Masters: "Ballesteros felt much better
> > Today after a 69."
> >
> > THE new stand at Doncaster race course took Brough Scott's breath
> > away..."My word," he said. "Look at that magnificent erection."
> >
> > WILLIE Carson was telling Claire Balding how jockeys prepare for a =
big
> > race, when he said: "They usually have four or five dreams a night =
about
> > coming from different positions."
> >
> > CARENZA Lewis about finding food in the Middle Ages on Time Team =
Live
> > said: "You'd eat beaver if you could get it."
> >
> > A FEMALE news anchor who, the day after it was supposed to have =
snowed
> > And didn't, turned to the weatherman and asked, "So Bob, where's =
that
> > eight inches you promised me last night?"
> >
> > Not only did HE have to leave the set, but half the crew did too,
> > because they were laughing so hard!
> >
> > US PGA Commentator - "One of the reasons Arnie (Arnold Palmer) is
> > playing so well is that, before each tee shot, his wife takes out =
his
> > balls and kisses them .... Oh my god!!!!! What have I just =
said?!!!!"
> >
> > METRO RADIO - "Julian Dicks is everywhere. It's like they've got =
eleven
> > Dicks on the field."
> >
> > HARRY Carpenter at the Oxford-Cambridge boat race 1977 - "Ah, isn't
> > that nice. The wife of the Cambridge President is kissing the Cox of =
the
> > Oxford crew."
> >
> > TED Walsh- Horse Racing Commentator - "This is really a lovely =
horse. I
> > once rode her mother."
> >
> > NEW Zealand Rugby Commentator - "Andrew Mehrtens loves it when Daryl
> > Gibson comes inside of him."
> >
> > PAT Glenn- Weightlifting commentator - "And this is Miss Gregoriava
> > from Bulgaria. I saw her snatch this morning and it was amazing!"
>

assured, i've been looking forward to spinning at this party
since the last one, where i passed out on the roof of my car in
full stickman gear, then proceeded to spin completely blasted
out-of-my-mind-drunk - so drunk that i had to grab onto the
tables in order to stand up.

it's going to be another rockstar night, and you should come
out and play.

july 25th Aaron


Tonight is the night! AEC is back again with another party in the great
outdoors. In celebration of all the leo birthdays out there we're going to
be taking you back to when all house//trance//breaks//dnb was *rave* music
and the hard lines drawn between the genres hadn't formed yet. It's a
special night where all of the dj's will be playing genres they used to
play, but no longer do. It's a re.re.re.wind night under the stars. Get
stupid silly and run around as your alter ego with the rest of the clan
tonight. We're going back to the same location as AEC :: Come As You Aren't
from 2 years ago. The spot is nestled in a secret valley where you can drive
into the location. Hear you local DJ favorites play music as their alter
egos! Bring a friend whether that be you neighbor, your classmate or that
cute barista that just hooked you up with a tripple venti caramel macciato
then licked their lips and smiled at you.

Check your seriousness at the door. Turn your goof on and come ready to
throw down silly style!

// Info line will be announced by *5pm* and updated at 11:30pm tonight! //

This is word of mouth from here on out. If you miss the email with the vm #
just ask around for it!

:: RULES ::
!! YOU MUST FOLLOW THEM!!
Go the speed limit and don't pass other cars.
A carload of *ravers* sticks out so please keep the sound systems turned
down as well.
If you see someone behind you or coming towards you on the road keep going
past the gate.
Make a mental note as to where the gate is and keep driving past it.
Turn around up the road a bit and wait for the car to pass so as not to draw
attention to the location.
Be patient if there happens to be traffic do not just head for the gate
anyway! The party goes all night with cooperation.
When you're alone on the road turn into the gate and someone will open it
for you. TURN OFF ALL LIGHTS.
Go SLOWLY through the gate and continue slowly up the hill and please DO NOT
use your brakes (break lights come on)
Once you have crested the hill there will be someone to direct you to
parking.
We ask that once you are at the party that you do not try to leave until
after 4am. Having cars going in and out of the space puts the entire party
at risk.
Keep flashlights low so that you don't light up the hillsides for road
traffic to see.
Do NOT wander up to the top of the hill at night. You are visible from the
road up there and especially with glowsticks or other lighted objects
There is heavy equipment in the area and although hot rodding it would be
fun, we ask that you leave it alone.
LEAVE NO TRACE - No garbage, cigarette butts, flyers, cans, bottles, etc

----- Original Message ----- 
From: <DJBigDaddyG@aol.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, July 25, 2003 2:39 PM
Subject: [sfraves] -ROLL CALL- 4 ALL LEOS BSP :: AEC :: RAWR! ::
**TONIGHT!** :: FREE :: 12am - 6a


july 23rd (first day) Warren
july 25th Aaron


Tonight is the night! AEC is back again with another party in the great
outdoors. In celebration of all the leo birthdays out there we're going to
be taking you back to when all house//trance//breaks//dnb was *rave* music
and the hard lines drawn between the genres hadn't formed yet. It's a
special night where all of the dj's will be playing genres they used to
play, but no longer do. It's a re.re.re.wind night under the stars. Get
stupid silly and run around as your alter ego with the rest of the clan
tonight. We're going back to the same location as AEC :: Come As You Aren't
from 2 years ago. The spot is nestled in a secret valley where you can drive
into the location. Hear you local DJ favorites play music as their alter
egos! Bring a friend whether that be you neighbor, your classmate or that
cute barista that just hooked you up with a tripple venti caramel macciato
then licked their lips and smiled at you.

Check your seriousness at the door. Turn your goof on and come ready to
throw down silly style!

// Info line will be announced by *5pm* and updated at 11:30pm tonight! //

This is word of mouth from here on out. If you miss the email with the vm #
just ask around for it!

:: RULES ::
!! YOU MUST FOLLOW THEM!!
Go the speed limit and don't pass other cars.
A carload of *ravers* sticks out so please keep the sound systems turned
down as well.
If you see someone behind you or coming towards you on the road keep going
past the gate.
Make a mental note as to where the gate is and keep driving past it.
Turn around up the road a bit and wait for the car to pass so as not to draw
attention to the location.
Be patient if there happens to be traffic do not just head for the gate
anyway! The party goes all night with cooperation.
When you're alone on the road turn into the gate and someone will open it
for you. TURN OFF ALL LIGHTS.
Go SLOWLY through the gate and continue slowly up the hill and please DO NOT
use your brakes (break lights come on)
Once you have crested the hill there will be someone to direct you to
parking.
We ask that once you are at the party that you do not try to leave until
after 4am. Having cars going in and out of the space puts the entire party
at risk.
Keep flashlights low so that you don't light up the hillsides for road
traffic to see.
Do NOT wander up to the top of the hill at night. You are visible from the
road up there and especially with glowsticks or other lighted objects
There is heavy equipment in the area and although hot rodding it would be
fun, we ask that you leave it alone.
LEAVE NO TRACE - No garbage, cigarette butts, flyers, cans, bottles, etc

From: =?iso-8859-1?B?T6dieSBKYW16 ?= <osby@hellokitty.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Fri, 25 Jul 2003 13:57:19 -0800
X-Originating-Ip: 198.144.204.8
X-Originating-Server: ws5-8.us4.outblaze.com
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] :CODE last night was Soooooo Dope!

OK... so like lastnight was Soooooooooooo AWESOME!!!  Good shit man!!! OK... the night started out when Tom (Denver HOuse DJ from SFR 4 those who can remember) & I got there & Shank was spinning Ambient stuff!  I guess I'll talk about the front room 1st....  OK, Then he totally got in2 this funky like minimal Techno kinda stuff!!  It was fun!!  Ooooooh my gosh man.... then he got in2 this Totally Yummy Electro that kicked my ass!!!  I couldn't stop dancing!!! Heeeeeeeeeello 2Day!

OK... I was hella buggin' during the next set 'cause Ooooooooh My Gooodness, Oh My Goooosh, Hello 2Day.... Praxis fucked shit up big time man!!  WHOA... he played this Mondo Groovy Live PA Techno set!!  It was funny 'cause when his set 1st started... I coulda sworn I heard a Ghetto tech beat!!  I swear... if U were there... U'd know what I was talkin' about when I saw he played 1 of the Grooviest Techno sets ever!!  I mean... & this shit was LIVE!!  Oooooh Wow... I Loved it!  Thank U sooooooo much Praxis!!!  I mean... was totally hard Techno all the way & man... his dark melodies that he wove in & out of his set totally made me dance & like totally yell from all that damn excitement!!!  Ooooooh man... so Dope!!

OK... unforetunately... T 1000 was unable 2 show up so Rich & Mel Summerhayes showed up in his place & lol.... they played this Wicked Techno set... Man...I Loved it!!!  LoL... it was sooo Awesome seein' those 2 after soooo long!!!  Oh My Goodness man... they played some wicked tracks & it was CooL 'cause Mel doesn't usual spin techno.. so it was nice seein' her totally get off like that!!!

OK... upstairs!!  Arson & G.Funk.Jeff opened up the room w/ their shit... wooooohoooo... I Loved it!!!  I mean... my 1 favorite part of their set well, G-Funk dropped this 1 track & it was a 1/2 speed slower than Jungle & it was this like Rock song that had a hip hop beat & it was fuckin' Sick man!!  I Loved it!!!

Ultra Violet went on next & she fucked it like usual!!  Hello 2Day... she played all my favorite Jungle tracks that she spins & ofcourse she was up on her usual mixer tricks!!!  Whoooooooooa man!!  

The Femmes went on next & Wow!!  OK... I think it was Tess when 1 dropped of my all time FAvorite Favorite Favorite Jungle tracks of all time!!!  It's a classic & I totally wish I knew the name & the artist... grrrr... but I Loved it!!!  It was Yummy!

OK... then 2 like my tooooootal Surprise... Ivry popped up!!  Good Shit man... i ain't seen that fucker since Eklektic a few months ago... it was So Dope!!!  So yeah... him & Aye-n this this fuckin' Bad Ass Jungle tag set!!!  Good shit man... OK... so Ivry has a bunch of tracks that I Love!!  I mean... I guess I'm old skool 'cause alot of his old Tracks I Love & when he buys new records... I dunno.... I don't dig 'em as much as his old shit or hmmmm.... maybe I'm like sooo last year.... la la la... anywaze... I think I danced the longest during their set (next 2 G Funk's & Arson's set) 'cause Ivry is 1 of my Mondo favorite Jungle DJs!!!

The vibe there was So Groovy... So manyt people showed up!!  LoL... I was havin' this mondo long ass conversation w/ Eric Rigsbee during Praxis's set & he was all sayin' that his set was so perfect that this is the only way that Techno should be played... LIVE!!  LoL

But yeah man... it was total Family night as usual last night!!!  I Loved it!!!  Oh My Goondess man... it was jus' soooooooo Awesome!!  LIterally... I had a smile on my face the whole night!!!  The best part of the night was when Terri (aka the buglady from planet Zooso [check the sfr profiles]) should up & WEEEEEEEEEE... my play mate was there & we always have soooooooo much fun when we get 2gether!!! LoL  I Love Terri 'cause seriously.... she my fuckin' playmate & whenever we get 2gether... we are so rowdy 2getrher!!!  LoL

Unfortunatly... we didn't stay 4 the last set 'cause  Tom had 2 work early & well... I'm still on a mondo job hunt (so if any1 knows anything... hint) but man.... I had a rerally good night!!  Seriously... it was Hard 2 decide what room I wanted 2 B in 'cause both rooms were pumpin out suck Yummy Yummy Yummy music!!  Good shit man... I Loved it!!!  Thank U :code 4 2 years of Groovy times & Happy Anniversay :code


Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

PERSONAL VOICES: REMEMBERING CELIA CRUZ
Savita Iyer, AlterNet

The Queen of Salsa had a way of bridging the many gaps that exist between 
Latins of different socio-economic classes and ethnic backgrounds.

http://www.alternet.org/story.html?StoryID=16485



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

> they used to

> stars. Get
> stupid silly and run around as your alter ego with the rest
> of the clan
> tonight. We're going back to the same location as AEC :: Come
> As You Aren't
> from 2 years ago. The spot is nestled in a secret valley
> where you can drive
> into the location. Hear you local DJ favorites play music as
> their alter
> egos! Bring a friend whether that be you neighbor, your
> classmate or that
> cute barista that just hooked you up with a tripple venti

> then licked their lips and smiled at you.

> come ready to

> :: RULES ::
> !! YOU MUST FOLLOW THEM!!
> Go the speed limit and don't pass other cars.
> A carload of *ravers* sticks out so please keep the sound
> systems turned
> down as well.
> If you see someone behind you or coming towards you on the
> road keep going
> past the gate.
> Make a mental note as to where the gate is and keep driving
> past it.
> Turn around up the road a bit and wait for the car to pass so
> as not to draw
> attention to the location.
> Be patient if there happens to be traffic do not just head
> for the gate
> anyway! The party goes all night with cooperation.
> When you're alone on the road turn into the gate and someone
> will open it
> for you. TURN OFF ALL LIGHTS.
> Go SLOWLY through the gate and continue slowly up the hill
> and please DO NOT
> use your brakes (break lights come on)
> Once you have crested the hill there will be someone to
> direct you to
> parking.
> We ask that once you are at the party that you do not try to
> leave until
> after 4am. Having cars going in and out of the space puts the
> entire party
> at risk.
> Keep flashlights low so that you don't light up the hillsides
> for road
> traffic to see.
> Do NOT wander up to the top of the hill at night. You are
> visible from the
> road up there and especially with glowsticks or other lighted
> objects
> There is heavy equipment in the area and although hot rodding
> it would be
> fun, we ask that you leave it alone.
> LEAVE NO TRACE - No garbage, cigarette butts, flyers, cans,
> bottles, etc

Importance: Normal

In-Reply-To: <BAY1-F172bCQ6MJpfzp00006176@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 26 Jul 2003 00:15:56.0850 (UTC) FILETIME=[15977920:01C3530B]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] Producer question..

I haven't used it much yet but both of my roommates and studio mate LOVE
IT!  Its not an all in one though and we use it with a midi controller
to bump up its functionalilty but it produces some great sounds across
the board and the samples are easy to find, use, edit and sequence.  I
liked Reaktor a lot and still like the fact you can program your own
tones/instruments but if you don't have the time for something like that
Reason 2 really produces some rich tones, almost an analog warmness that
I'm surprised comes from software and in general people love to use it
and work with it.  Just never limit yourself to one thing of course but
Reason 2 in my mind is a great tool that digital producers should have
in their lineup.  

-Rayn

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Producer question..

I have found myself liking Buzz more and more lately. I have played with
several of the heavyweights of home producing and Buzz just clicked for
me. I think each producer has a program that they just feel comfortable
with. Yeah Buzz is freeware but it isn't the cost of your programs that
decide the quality of your music. Play around with some different
programs and find out what is most comfortable for you and run with it.
Peace

Jason Philips
Compos-Mentis
Problematic Beats

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Producer question..

I take flak for it sometimes, but I like Reason plenty. Primarily, it's 
for financial reasons. Of course, I do more pop-structured compositions 
for which it's probably not meant, but after running the tracks through 
various filters after bringing them into Logic or Deck, I rarely find 
anyone complaining about the problems with accuracy/sound quality.  
It's just my songwriting skills I need to beef up ;)

Here are a couple of clips:
http://tavallai.com/music/clips/thought.mp3
http://tavallai.com/music/clips/mine.mp3

  - omid

Blasphemental II : A Night Out of Time

Saturday the 26th of July 2003 in Oakland @ le Noodle Factory
Corner of 26th Street and Union off West Grand Ave. In Oakland

Come support this TranceVillage benefit party
free before 10pm - $10 at the door - all ages

Each DJ impersonates their favorite producer, Psy with a twist!!
Each producer chosen has in some way made an important contribution to the Psychedelic Trance/ Goa genre.

9 Shpongle - by Lady Suddenly (Phoenix Family)
10 Silicon Sound – by Tobal (g.o.a. play)
11 Oforia - by Neo Logic (Bio Harmonics/Phoenix Family)
12 Biodegradeable and frenz – by psTony (g.o.a. play/Phoenix Family)
1 Cosma – by Psynthetic (g.o.a. play)
2 Mr. Peculiar – by Spook (geomagnetic/Phoenix Family)
3 Synthetic/Deedrah – by Sentient (THUMP/Phoenix Family)
4 Skazi – by Obu (Bombay Power)
5 Mdimiliz/Spiralianz – by Nagual (Full Circle/Phoenix Family)
6 Sandman – by CHM (g.o.a. play)

Thanyou everybody for the great suggestions for bands…
I didn’t hear back from Blondie… but we are allowed to go late so if I forgot anyone or there is a desire for more stompin madness we can add another dj!
************************************************************************
and go to corner of 8th on Foslom to the Luna Lounge from 6-10p tonight for some sweet psy action!

I just got reason 2.5 and the new fx are bomb!!! if you plan to seriously go with reason, make sure you have good hardware (sound card, hd) so you can rewire it to something like cubase or nuendo (cheap hardware=hella latency=sequencing nightmare)....then the possibilities are endless!!!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] what to do with ten dollars nrr

--0-594356543-1059188748=:25149
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

i am so ready to go on a trip myself. i don't know where yet, because there are many places i would enjoy. also, i want to plan around anyone i know who likes to travel, but who i am also sort of nice to but avoiding. i saw one such person this morning.....he is exhausted from traveling. i think that is really good timing, because then when i go, i won't have to worry that he will ask to join me. all i really ever wanted to do with that person was to say, "hello" and be very distant. so far, so good, but i have had to work at it. something else that is grand to spend small bucks on are used classical music works. i like to have some old sheet music or books that are falling apart next to my bed to look at for pleasure or to give me something to work on when people who are sort of my friends are out of town or at least have the common sense to save "it" for the ears that are more tolerant than mine. :) :) :) i was going to go hear some music this evening, but i have to be up early,
 and it looks like everything will also be much to loud, and if i am going to hear it loud, i am saving for the love of it all, but also, it sure would be nice to have a glass of wine...oh, one more cheap thrill...the marc chagall exhibit at the sfmoma....sf related. i am totally up on world museums. i was reading that on the free day, the marc chagall exhibit will cost a small $5.00. he is one of my very favorite artists. :)

when i have ten dollars...extra...i'm tempted to run to clement street and pick up a mini-accordion at the music shop...or ... i hear the startup of a boeing jet engine ... it's 10 bucks towards that round the world plane ticket...only $3-- to go...every little bit helps.  i usually have fun for free...so that $10 helps me get on that plane

Geri Dahl <eeelips@yahoo.com> wrote: when i have ten dollars, i usually will eat something, go somewhere fun, buy something to wear, a new scent, some new lipstick, go to a place where i can dance with as little bothering as possible...the last thing i would do is go somewhere to visit someone i don't want to see. i can't believe anyone would think even for one instance that i would go to visit someone that i am not at all interested in. i also can't believe that someone would ever think that i would be as immature as they need me to be just based on their own hypnotic suggestion. anyway, i know how to have real fun with ten dollars and it has never involved hanging out with some jerk or some jerks. :)

X-Authentication-Warning: cygnus.isr.umd.edu: odjallen owned process doing -bs
Date: Sat, 26 Jul 2003 05:17:33 -0400 (EDT)
From: j a c k s 0 n <odjallen@glue.umd.edu>
X-X-Sender: odjallen@cygnus.isr.umd.edu
To: new-michigan-raves@yahoogroups.com, NorCalDNB@topica.com,
   sfraves@hyperreal.org
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.4.53.0307260517140.24628@cygnus.isr.umd.edu>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio Tonight : A.L.I.A.S. Takeover : K-Lungz :.

boh boh boh!

got some ill drum 'n' bass for y'all tonight.

the veritable A.L.I.A.S. residents are showin' tonight as well as Partner
in Crime K-Lungz.  All ill dnb stylee.  Check out the lineup:

07-09 pm EST - K-Lungz [Stonefinger, In The Mix 88.1 FM, Dirtbox Radio,
Partners in Crime, K-Yun.com // DC]
09-11 pm EST - Titts & Arse [A.L.I.A.S., Krunk, Kind Bass Inc.,
Tittsworth.com // DC]
11-01 am EST - John Tab [A.L.I.A.S., Buzzlife.com // DC]
01-03 am EST - ODJ [A.L.I.A.S., Dirtbox Radio, Partners in Crime,
Trividual Productions // DC]

K-Lungz (aka K-Yun) has played venues around the globe, drawing on many
years of musical experience playing drums in a variety of bands as well as
hangin around the studio quite a bit.  Currently the Lungz co-hosts In the
Mix (http://www.inthemix1.com) with DeeJay Clutch, every Thursday night on
college Park's own 88.1 FM.  Make sure y'all tune in (you can grab web
audio links on the site) on August 7th, as they celebrate their 4-year
anniversary.

A.L.I.A.S. is held every week at one of DC's premeir venues, Nation,
alongside one of our longest-running Goth nights, Alchemy.  It's a really
tight mix of cats, featuring DNB, Breaks, Electro, EBM, and a host of live
Goth acts and such.  A.L.I.A.S. residents John Tab, Titts & Arse (Jesse
Tittsworth & Brian Arsenault), and Dirtbox's own ODJ hold down fort
alongside featured artists including Total Science, Baron, A-Sides, and
Twisted Individual.  It's always a good time, it's cheap, and they have $5
pitchers:):)  Send ODJ an email for more information & reduced list spots.

To tune in tonight, go to http://www.dirtboxradio.com/listen.html or click
on one of the following direct links:
64k stream - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k stream - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls
chatroom - http://jungletrain.net/chat.htm
webcam - http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

Archives of the night will be stored, as always, on our website - so that
way you can listen to 'em again:)

If you'd like to come and play on Dirtbox, send us an email at
bookme@dirtboxradio.com.  We feature mostly DNB, with a spattering of
Breaks and Hip-Hop talent.  If you're well outside of the DC Metro area,
just send us a CD and if we like it, we'll play it!  That includes
production as well.

I hope to see y'all online & in the chat room tonight.  Be safe, and eat
your weaties.

Jackson (ODJ)
[Partners in Crime, Dirtbox Radio, Trividual Productions, A.L.I.A.S.]

.....................jackson.
.partners.in.crime...........
.dirtbox.radio...............
.trividual.productions.......
.third.leg.productions.......
.a.l.i.a.s...................
.........................odj.

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


On Saturday Night in San Francisco, Elektrosorcery presents the first =
installment of the new Zodiac Masquerade series.... LEO.
July 23 - August 22

 The lion symbolizes Leo, and people born under this sign are often as =
proud as the king of the jungle himself. Leo is a very ambitious and =
strong-willed sign, and Leos like nothing better than being the center =
of attention.  As in the animal kingdom, female Leos tend to be a bit =
more dominant. Both exes can be practical, philosophical, and spiritual, =
which helps them to get their way of thinking across. Leos are strongly =
attracted to the opposite sex, too.  Relating back to your animal =
instincts, you are most likely to be a lover of nature. Like the lion, =
you are seen as noble and very proud; you cannot tolerate teasing. You =
always fight fairly, though at times you may lack tact and diplomacy. =
The only time you might gripe is when you're ill or stressed, which is =
rare. Overall, this is a most agreeable sign to be born under because of =
the generous basis that it lends to you.=20

Come celebrate the Sign of LEO with fellow Leos: Tracer, Enemy, Charlie, =
Suess, and Leprechaun.

In the Elektrosorcery chamber witness the magik of: Majere, E-Light, =
Achilles, Dekota, Cauze, and Atom One.

Feel the deep roar of the Lion with the bass sounds of the Skills =
Junglists: Bicolas, DOS, B Dub, Lady Ms. B, E$kr, and Uptown.

Limited $15 tickets available at F-8, Skills, and Solid Grooves.

Free face painting all night, wild costumes encouraged, prizes given =
away to each Leo at the party. =20

Elektrosorcery event line:  415-267-6921

www.elektrosorcery.com

From sfraves-return-104284-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sat Jul 26 21:27:06 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-104284-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 57607 invoked by uid 1103); 26 Jul 2003 21:27:06 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 57592 invoked from network); 26 Jul 2003 21:27:06 -0000
Message-ID: <20030726212703.95554.qmail@web80601.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Sat, 26 Jul 2003 14:27:03 -0700 (PDT)
From: Giles Bowkett <giles_bowkett@yahoo.com>
To: "Macadio G." <macadio@hotmail.com>, sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <BAY1-F8aNgEpTX5V3Gy0000647c@hotmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Producer question.. 

The new London Elektricity album "Billion Dollar
Gravy" features two tracks created entirely within
Reason, namely "The Great Drum & Bass Swindle" and the
title track "Billion Dollar Gravy."

This isn't that unusual, actually, but in the same
article the L.E. guy mentions that he has a track
coming out on his label Hospital -- the highly
respected label that discovered High Contrast -- from
another producer which was produced entirely in Acid!

He also says Reason is a tricky beast, because altho
he was very happy with the two tracks he put on his
album, his experiences with it in terms of audio
quality vary tremendously, and he frequently creates
tracks in Reason and then uses ReWire to send the
audio into programs like Logic and ProTools to get a
better sound.

btw I got all this from the new Future Music. :-)

My own opinion: Reason 2.5 kicks ass over Reason 2.0.
The reverb is still more metallic than I'd like it,
but I want the distortion unit to fuck me. It's that
good. The best addition is the signal spliiters for
both CV and audio. This means you can have
functionally polyphonic Matrix sequencers now, where
before you couldn't; it also allows for more
expressive patch design (using filters, panning, and
effects). The vocoder's neat too; you can actually use
it to construct a multi-band compressor, just by
putting it in EQ mode, isolating specific frequencies,
and compressing them. Then you merge it all up again
in an audio spliiter/merger, and you're set. Also, the
CV splitter can invert signals in the merger mode,
which is fucking nuts.

It's going to be years before I bother with any other
audio gadgets. (Altho I really really REALLY want a
V-Station, and the entire Native line makes me horny.)
I sold a Prophecy, an MPC2K, and a bunch of other shit
and replaced it all with Reason. Then again, DJ Hype
sold a 30,000 pound studio (equiv. to approx $45K) and
replaced it with Logic running plugins! So who can
say.


Giles

just my potentially rotten opinion, but if your psychologist is boring, you need a new approach...either that or a new psychologist. therapy is not boring. i would have never ever considered making a leap like that as a career if i saw a lot of teachers and therapists being boring in their schools, offices or seminars. also, kind of not related, but also related in a small way...i am into dreams and i took a psychology class in college that had a big dream section in it...last night i dreamt that a man made a baby cry and tossed it on its' head...i took the baby away from him, and i held it really close to me, and the baby stopped crying, but the police wouldn't come, 911 wouldn't help me, and everyone i talked to in the dream, including the babies mother didn't care, so i held the baby close to me all night long, and then, when i woke up, i had been hugging myself the whole time so tight that both of my hands were falling asleep. that was free by the way, so i still have 10 bucks to
 blow. :)

That was a damn fun night. I got to see a Segway in person and I got to =
ride one too! I dunno if they're worth the money, but damn that's a cool =
as hell product. Anyway it was really surreal out there last night. Sooo =
foggy, nothing but 4 blacklights, and complete darkness around you. Saw =
a lot of people I hadn't seen in a while which was great. Gothby//Oseric =
made an appearance. Goodbye tomorrow! The music was all over the place =
and got a lot of people dancing. I loved hearing Andy W spinning hip hop =
and mixing that into Tears For Fears! I was the kid in the NorCal hoody =
running around all night. Good times. Good times... =3D)

place where the darkness in the sky could almost touch my black soul!  It 
was nice, as cold as my heart, dark, & almost foggy in some places!

Unfortunately I wasn't alone like I hoped!  There was this totally crappy 
music playing, all these Dorky STupid people dancing, & it was gross & 
disgusting!

REM should of made a song called STUPID HAPPY PEOPLE because all that happy 
dancing shit was driving me insane!  The only reason I was there as long as 
I was was because I was mentally kicking & stomping on all those peoples 
heads!  I also thought it important to bring the message of depression to 
the masses!  So I told people the whole night to Fuck Off & jump off a cliff 
or take a shower w/ a toaster!  It was a really bad time!

Whatever!  That's it!  Bye!

Goodbye 2morrow,

Osric Gothby

already are a non-profit and their current project is
the basis of the non-profit I wanted to start.

us out, basically a service that artists sign up for
that lists their skills and allows them to search for
artists in their area.  We have no money to fund this
but can work out a tax deduction for you if you'd
like.

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 89648 invoked from network); 27 Jul 2003 00:29:04 -0000
From: Cherushiiko@aol.com
Message-ID: <3a.3c571d01.2c5476c5@aol.com>
Date: Sat, 26 Jul 2003 20:28:53 EDT
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: 7.0 for Windows sub 10637
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Review: Sintaxxx-- mixed feelings....


Judging from the super-long BSP, DJ lineup, and the amount of hype it was 
given, I thought this was going to be a huge party. I wasn't sure if I really 
wanted to go to or not, as I am not a big fan of porno-themed raves, and was 
disappointed about T-1000 canceling, but I did want to see Praxis and Dietrich 
Schoenemann. I had hoped to check out some other parties this evening, but Sean 
was pretty set on going to Sintaxxx, so to Sintaxxx we went. 

We arrived around 1:00am, which is usually peak party time, but it looked 
like everyone had gone home already. There were about 15 people in the techno 
room and 30 in the d'n'b room. As for that house room, we never found it. Maybe I 
wasn't looking hard enough...? Was there a third room?? 

Fortunately, the porn theme pretty much ended at the phone sex operator voice 
mail message. I guess we missed the porno karaoke thing. Not a lot of people 
were dressed up for the party, including Sean and I, who are both modest 
people that don't own any porn star clothing. I couldn't really imagine techno fans 
putting on their vinyl g-strings and nipple tassels for a party... 

Though the turnout was low, the music was really good. MC One seamlessly 
blended techno with ravey trance, which turned out a lot better than it sounds. We 
were really impressed by Praxis, who delivered an energetic live techno set. 
It made me happy to see the crowd get so into it-- every time he'd tweak a 
knob on the SH-101 or wave his hand over the Air-FX, people would holler and 
point and get all excited about it. Sean and I danced a lot, and so did everyone 
else, so everybody was pretty exhausted by the time Dietrich Schoenemann came 
on at 3:00. When we first arrived at the party we talked to Dietrich a little 
bit, and he complained about playing to 20 people at a party earlier in the 
night. I felt bad when everyone took off after Praxis' set-- there were only a 
few people left in the Techno room 10 minutes into Dietrich's set. Sean and I 
carried out our duty as The Only People Still Dancing and stayed until the party 
was over. Dietrich played a good set, and I think the people at the party 
would have enjoyed it if they weren't so wrecked after dancing so hard to Praxis' 
set. 

Overall, the good music saved this mediocre party. This party got way too 
much hype considering it was just a no-frills techno and jungle party. More 
attention to detail probably would have made it more worth the $15 admission 
charge. I can't complain too much though, because I had fun and that's the most 
important part. 

Love, Chel-C Faith

www.defsf.com
a west coast techno alliance



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Friday, August 8, 2003 ** Origin **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: FC Kahuna with opening set by Taj
Bassment: Tom Slik Dead Dan Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: DJ Torque Kepi & Kat DJ Hanna
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

Three years ago, Dan and Jon Kahuna made the decision that would decide
their future - they closed the doors on the Big Kahuna Burger, the club
that made their name but lost its way, and opened them on new night
Headstart. The result was a new sense of direction, one that has now given
birth to Machine Says Yes, their debut album as FC Kahuna. Machine Says
Yes is an electrifying fusion of futurist acid house and silicon soul,
driven by the sense of adventure and distaste for the mainstream that have
always been the pair's stock in trade. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San
Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info:
www.euphoriadreams.com; 415.431.1200

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches beyond the local scene
to all corners of the Terra Firma - thanks to everyone whose support of
and contribution to the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each longitude and
latitude perspective that makes this beautiful place we know as Earth our
home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes, deprecated event
information, or any other information pertaining to events in the greater
SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina Powers
karina@hyperreal.org

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
