On Saturday, July 26, 2003, at 05:28  PM, Cherushiiko@aol.com wrote:

>
> Judging from the super-long BSP, DJ lineup, and the amount of hype it 
> was
> given, I thought this was going to be a huge party. I wasn't sure if I 
> really
> wanted to go to or not, as I am not a big fan of porno-themed raves, 
> and was
> disappointed about T-1000 canceling, but I did want to see Praxis and 
> Dietrich
> Schoenemann. I had hoped to check out some other parties this evening, 
> but Sean
> was pretty set on going to Sintaxxx, so to Sintaxxx we went.
>
> We arrived around 1:00am, which is usually peak party time, but it 
> looked
> like everyone had gone home already. There were about 15 people in the 
> techno
> room and 30 in the d'n'b room. As for that house room, we never found 
> it. Maybe I
> wasn't looking hard enough...? Was there a third room??
>
> Fortunately, the porn theme pretty much ended at the phone sex 
> operator voice
> mail message. I guess we missed the porno karaoke thing. Not a lot of 
> people
> were dressed up for the party, including Sean and I, who are both 
> modest
> people that don't own any porn star clothing. I couldn't really 
> imagine techno fans
> putting on their vinyl g-strings and nipple tassels for a party...
>
> Though the turnout was low, the music was really good. MC One 
> seamlessly
> blended techno with ravey trance, which turned out a lot better than 
> it sounds. We
> were really impressed by Praxis, who delivered an energetic live 
> techno set.
> It made me happy to see the crowd get so into it-- every time he'd 
> tweak a
> knob on the SH-101 or wave his hand over the Air-FX, people would 
> holler and
> point and get all excited about it. Sean and I danced a lot, and so 
> did everyone
> else, so everybody was pretty exhausted by the time Dietrich 
> Schoenemann came
> on at 3:00. When we first arrived at the party we talked to Dietrich a 
> little
> bit, and he complained about playing to 20 people at a party earlier 
> in the
> night. I felt bad when everyone took off after Praxis' set-- there 
> were only a
> few people left in the Techno room 10 minutes into Dietrich's set. 
> Sean and I
> carried out our duty as The Only People Still Dancing and stayed until 
> the party
> was over. Dietrich played a good set, and I think the people at the 
> party
> would have enjoyed it if they weren't so wrecked after dancing so hard 
> to Praxis'
> set.
>
> Overall, the good music saved this mediocre party. This party got way 
> too
> much hype considering it was just a no-frills techno and jungle party. 
> More
> attention to detail probably would have made it more worth the $15 
> admission
> charge. I can't complain too much though, because I had fun and that's 
> the most
> important part.
>
> Love, Chel-C Faith
>
> www.defsf.com
> a west coast techno alliance
>
>
>

----> WHO<---------------------------------------
Music by:
Lorin (bassnectar)
Jeno  (Wicked)
Gianni (Spundae)
Kramer (Arrival/ Release/ djkramer.com)
Jonathan Ojeda (Spundae/ Sound A.M.)

JZ (Red Melon)

Syd Gris (Opel/ Infuse/ Radiance)
Jondi (Qool/ Looq)
Zack Darling (Decadence / Mystic Beat Lounge)
Tim Pratt (Opel/ Garage Mahal)
Shanti (Blyss Abyss / Divine Rhythm Society)
Dagny (Tranquility Base/ Ass Bomb)
Erin Coull (house of breaks)

----> WHAT<-------------------------------------
Infuse is a dance, music, and art event thrown for the
purpose of getting lots of cool people together to
subliminally infect them with liberation germination.
Community, friendliness, permission to BE, and rockin
dance floors are standard operating procedure.
This Infuse will help raise money as well for the Opelent
Temple of Kaos at BM 2K3.

INfuse will feature:  4 transformed dance areas - Midnight
gathering re: the meaning of life - Our big phat comfy chill
space - Performance art - Visuals by On the Fly Films -
transcendental tendencies designed to nudge the evolution
of your consciousness while surrounded by friendly freaks
and positive party people - and much, much more...

----> WHERE<------------------------------------
Kelly's Mission Rock
817 China Basin Way
San Francisco
take 3rd st. to Mariposa,
east on Mariposa,
turns into China Basin Way

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no

Subject: [sfraves] sintaxxx (while you were sleeping)

woah, i'm still wrecked from sintaxxx, and i'm sure the talent is too by now. i'd have to say the techno at this party was simply wicked. i haven't seen djs spin such hard wax since Dj Rush came to town with ASR's "as you like it" (props to ASR). Praxis rocked the house all the way live and came representing fully with every bit of flavor in his live set. the set almost killing all left standing with originality and live sequncing of crashing techno madness.  MC-One crushed it with fresh energy and well timed tracks while a people just bailed on Schoeneman.
 -For those who made the egregious error of sleeping on Dietrich Schoeneman's dj set, you really missed out. excellent planning and record programming under an hour and with the most hard, funked, and pounding tracks you might have not thought possible. 
        when i came to this party i came prepared for the worst. half expecting porn stars and more than gratuitous nudity.. maybe i came late for that, but what i witnessed from the techno heads at the space was phenomenal. i was dismayed that at a few points i looked behind me and saw no-one else dancing even though i was up front with a few others. yet everything was just clicking and locking and feeling right on time to the beat in front of me, that i didn't take the time to notice for too long. 
I guess the point of this e-mail is that the survivors left ambulatory at the end had witnessed a powerful music experience and it should have been shared (i was stone cold sober BTW).  you just had to be there, i guess. -Sean Ocean
-- 

VISIT::
www.defsf.com
"a fine site for techno in the west"

Thank you to all that came out to AEC :: RAWR! last night. You guys are =
hardcore! It wasn't the best weather conditions last night and yet still =
80+ people braved the weather and came to the party. The people =
celebrating their birthdays at this party were ecstatic about the large =
turnout. You all really made that a special night for some people.=20

Thank you to the dj's (michael, andy, tyler, andrew, john, nick and =
jason) for lending your talents for the night. Big thank you to =
Cloudfactory for the use of their generators after our primary generator =
was deemed inoperable earlier that day. Of course none of this would =
have been possible if it weren't for the generosity of Marshal from =
SwatSound who while sick as hell *still* came out and dropped off//setup =
the sound for us. If you ever need professional sound for your party =
he's your guy. It was a great group effort and a wonderful reunion of =
people that hadn't seen each other in a while. Hope to see you all at =
the next one.

Masse's Nightclub :: 21+ w/ID, Free
Weekly Guest :: Sheztek (Moksha Tribe)

Estuary :: (Noun) 1. Where the river blends with the sea. 2. A place 
where all styles mix.

Every Monday from 9pm-11:30pm and 12:30pm-2am we will have 1/2 hour 
open deck slots. Sign ups 8:30pm-9pm, first come first served! Come 
early!! These slots go quickly! If you have no skills at all, but have
some cool tracks that you'd like to share, you are just as welcome as
anyone else! ***Please bring needles and headphones.***

lovely people a taste of what is to come...

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SRR:  Neurofeedback to Enhance Musical Performance

--=====================_11505908==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

**********************************************************************
Neurofeedback to Enhance Musical Performance
**********************************************************************
Bio-feedback, also dubbed neurofeedback, a technique that monitors brain
wave activity via electroencephalogram technologies, was initially used
to treat depression, sleep disorders, head injuries and other health
problems.

Today, the use of technologies like transcranial magnetic stimulation,
or EEG neurofeedback techniques are shifting from therapeutic
applications to those aimed at performance enhancement. The latest use
of this technology allows users to see and alter their own brain waves
by using a visual representation of their neural patterns. This BBC
article cites recent research in the use of neurofeedback to improve
musical ability. Dr Tobias Egner says: "This is the first time
[neurofeedback] has been used to improve a complex set of skills such as
musical performance in healthy students."

 >> Read More at: http://www.cognitiveliberty.org/neuro/neurofeedback.html


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Bob Hope dies at 100

Just thought this was sad.

http://www.upi.com/view.cfm?StoryID=3D20030728-015624-7629r

Bob Hope, entertainment titan, dies at 100=20
By Pat Nason
UPI Hollywood Reporter
Published 7/28/2003 3:14 PM
View printer-friendly version


LOS ANGELES, July 28 (UPI) -- Bob Hope, who died at the age of 100 =
Sunday evening at his home in Toluca Lake, Calif., was one of the most =
successful and beloved figures in the history of entertainment.

Hope died of pneumonia at 9:28 p.m., said a publicist for the versatile =
performer -- one of the last surviving entertainers who achieved stardom =
across the board in vaudeville, radio, Broadway, movies and TV.

Hope's 100th birthday, May 29, was celebrated throughout the United =
States and in his native England.

Hope -- one of the most decorated performers ever -- added to his list =
of honors when the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce renamed the legendary =
intersection of Hollywood and Vine as Bob Hope Square, and the Los =
Angeles County Board of Supervisors named Hope Citizen of the Century.=20

President George W. Bush mourned Hope's death in a statement issued as =
he was boarding Air Force One at Andrews Air Force Base.

"Bob Hope made us laugh, and he lifted our spirits," said Bush. "Bob =
Hope served our nation when he went to battlefields to entertain =
thousands of troops from different generations."

In Los Angeles, Nancy Reagan issued a statement calling Hope "one of our =
dearest friends for over sixty years -- losing him is like losing a =
member of the family. Ronnie always said that Bob was one of our finest =
ambassadors for America and for freedom, spending his lifetime =
entertaining servicemen and women away from home and overseas, =
especially in time of conflict."

Hope -- best known for rapid-fire one-liners, quips and gags -- tickled =
audiences during the dark days of the Depression and World War II and =
became a hero to millions of servicemen and women whom he entertained =
from World War II to the Persian Gulf.

He was nearly 90 when he went to the Gulf.His timely monologues on =
politics, politicians, economics and life in America made him a national =
institution.

His wife, Dolores, told United Press International in an interview in =
the mid-'90s that Hope's monologues provided a roadmap to American =
history over the second half of the 20th century.=20

A frequent and favorite emcee at the Academy Awards, Hope entertained -- =
and was entertained by -- presidents and foreign heads of state. He was =
an unofficial court jester of sorts to both Democrats and Republicans, =
visiting the White House during the administrations from Franklin D. =
Roosevelt to Bill Clinton -- all of whom were subject to his biting wit.

On June 1, 2000, three days after his 97th birthday, Hope underwent =
emergency medical treatment at a Rancho Mirage, Calif., hospital for an =
intestinal problem. Hope and wife Delores had just returned from a =
three-week trip to the East Coast, where he opened the Bob Hope Gallery =
Of Entertainment at the Library Of Congress and donated 88,000 pages of =
comedy material -- including many of his classic jokes. In 2001, a bout =
with bronchitis landed him in a hospital for several days.

During the summer of 1998, a member of the U.S. House of Representatives =
read an erroneous Internet report on the House floor that Hope had died. =
After a correction was made a few minutes later, Hope laughed it off.

Born Leslie Townes Hope May 29, 1903, in Eltham, England, the fifth of a =
stonemason's seven sons, he emigrated at age 4 with his family to =
Cleveland. He was educated in public schools and worked briefly as a =
clerk and fought for a short time as an amateur boxer under the name of =
Packy East.

As he put it, "In my third fight I hit the other man's hand so hard with =
my chin that I woke up in the dressing room. After that I quit."

Hope's debut as a performer was as part of a dance act with another =
youth, George Byrne, and a two-week engagement with Fatty Arbuckle when =
the silent screen star played a Cleveland theater. Hope changed his =
first name to Bob and did a blackface act in vaudeville with Byrne in =
Detroit, Pittsburgh and New York.

He became a single act in New Castle, Ind., when he was asked to =
introduce Marshall Walker and his Whiz Bang Revue. His quips had the =
audience roaring with laughter, enough to encourage him to become a =
comedian, playing small night clubs and stag parties.

It was a long, hard climb and for several years he barely eked out a =
living. Eventually he was signed by the Interstate Circuit, a vaudeville =
organization that took him to New York where he became a headliner with =
the RKO circuit. Gradually he made the transition from vaudeville to =
legitimate theater and by 1927 he was in his first Broadway show, "The =
Sidewalks Of New York."

Between 1928 and 1932 he traveled the nightclub and small-theater =
circuit as a stand-up comic. Later in 1932 he reached the Broadway stage =
in the musical comedy "Ballyhoo." His first big part came in 1933's =
"Roberta" and he began earning star salaries for "Ziegfeld Follies" and =
"Red Hot and Blue."

During the run of "Roberta," Hope met nightclub singer Delores Reade. =
They were married in 1934. They have four children, Linda, Tony, Nora =
and Kelly.

Hope first performed on radio in 1935 and three years later had his own =
show on a major network, joining such comedic giants as Eddie Cantor, =
Jack Benny and Edgar Bergen. Hope surpassed them all with 1,145 =
broadcasts.

He made his movie debut in "The Big Broadcast Of 1938," a box-office hit =
that introduced the song "Thanks for the Memory," which became his theme =
song. He starred in more than 50 movies, including "The Cat and the =
Canary"

(1939),"Caught in the Draft" (1941), "My Favorite Blonde" (1942), =
"Louisiana Purchase" (1941), "The Paleface" (1948), "The Lemon Drop Kid" =
(1951), "The Seven Little Foys" (1955), "Alias Jesse James" (1959) and =
many more.

His most popular movies, however, were his "Road" pictures, mostly in =
the '40s, co-starring with longtime friends Bing Crosby and Dorothy =
Lamour, starting with 1940's "The Road to Singapore." They were =
Paramount's most successful films of the '40s, and from 1941 to 1953, =
except for 1948, Hope ranked among the top 10 studio moneymakers.

Hope's final movie starring role came in 1972's "Cancel My Reservations" =
although he made several cameo appearances after that.

He was one of the first radio and screen stars to recognize the =
potential of television. Soon after the completion of the =
transcontinental coaxial cable, Hope began a weekly 60-minute television =
series. It continued well into the 1960s -- always at the top of the =
ratings -- when the demands on his time became too great. He reduced his =
workload to six specials a year.=20

Hope, who regularly employed eight gag writers at huge salaries to =
supply him with topical quips, was praised for his phenomenal memory of =
jokes.

"I can recall thousands of jokes but they usually come to mind in =
association with something else," Hope said. "But I've told so many =
jokes over the years there's no way that I can remember more than a =
fraction of them."

Hope was one of a handful of entertainers to be awarded four stars on =
the Hollywood Walk of Fame, one each for movies, radio, TV and theater.=20

A longtime host of the annual Academy Awards ceremonies, Hope never got =
an Oscar for acting but was given special Oscars or other honors five =
times -- in 1940, 1944, 1952, 1959 and 1965 -- for his humanitarianism =
and contributions to the film industry.

On Oct. 29, 1997, Congress honored Hope by naming him an honorary =
veteran.

"I've traveled all over the world and never met a better audience than =
this," he told Congress.

In 1998 he received an honorary knighthood from Queen Elizabeth. "What =
an honor and what a surprise for a boy born in England, raised in =
Cleveland and schooled in vaudeville," he said.

On the night of May 29, 1983, Hope's 80th birthday, he was honored at =
Washington's Kennedy Center with a three-hour telecast that featured a =
score of celebrities, including Frank Sinatra, George Burns and Lucille =
Ball as well as stars who were not born when Hope became a household =
name.

During the late 1960s and early 1970s Hope came in for some criticism =
for his political leanings and support of U.S. involvement in foreign =
wars.=20

But honorary degrees from various universities around the country and =
his long-running romance with the public enabled him to weather the =
negative reaction.

Hope was an avid golfer. He sponsored a PGA golf tournament at Palm =
Springs each year, and had a small golf course built on the grounds of =
his Toluca Lake estate.

Hope was also a part owner of the Cleveland Indians baseball team at one =
time.

For years, Hope was one of the wealthiest men in America, with a =
personal fortune largely made up of real estate holdings.




Copyright =A9 2001-2003 United Press International

Subject: [sfraves] Going back to school party 8/16

 Talk about positive karma!!!! A teacher in a class I'm taking turned me
on to a program funded by a bunch of tech industries and the government
that, if your accepted, will pay for your upgrade in your computer skills
(like being competent with CompTIA Network +,CompTIA A +, Windows 2000
server, DOSS, Bookkeeper, Microsoft MOUS/Red Hat certification, computer
repair, etc.). Not a big deal for all the advanced teckies on the list,
but for me it's a big deal, mostly because it's all free and EDD
accepted! Things I've been wanting to do for a long time, but never
having enough money or time to do. Why I feel so thankful is that this
program is very limited (only 20 people accepted) and next year it won't
be free anymore and I was fortunate enough to be at the right place and
at the right time to get in. I'll be going to school much of the week and
doing mandatory community service on the side (to help pay for my
training), upgrading and building computers for the Oakland Schools. And
what else is pretty cool about all this is that I can upgrade my computer
for free for volunteering. 

 Free school and free hardware!!!

 What this shows is that, even in hard economic times like these, there
is a way to make it. We just have to know what our way or making it is.
It took lot of faith in myself, in my dreams and goals, in the goodness
and timing of life and in the karma of it all to have this opportunity
come to me.

 So, to celebrate my wonderful blessings, I'm considering doing a free
day party at my house on Saturday, August 16th, the weekend before
school, if this is a good date. I have a pretty good size back yard and
the neighbors are cool about the music during the day if I give them a
warning. 

 Here's my idea:
Begin around noonish until dark, may push it longer if we can keep it not
too loud.
Someone will help provide a sound system and turntables (mine's not all
that good)
I'll buy a keg (for 21 and over peeps)
Everybody contribute in bringing bbq stuff for a bbq and picnic
and let's party!!!

 If your interested in celebrating with me, hit back with a RSVP and let
me know if you will help with anything so I'll know how many people to
expect. Suggestions to help make this a hella phat party are definatly
welcome!

 To keep things safe and from potentialy getting out of hand, this will
not an open party. This is for SFravers, and invited guests only. 

 Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

Subject: Re: [sfraves] ugh nrr


Geri Dahl wrote:
> i was thinking about velocity, but velocity isn't boring 

Ain't that the fuckin' truth. I just got back from shredding my favorite mogul
field  on rollerblades tonight -- the "wavy" concrete outside of 
pac-bell-stadium  (between the stadium and the water). If you get going pretty
fast, you can slalom between the crests and the hills, and get this really 
cool rhythm going. I had some 100BPM Indian Hip-Hop/Bhangra playing on
the Ipod and it was SWEEET -- tha big drums going whoooomph.... 
dum--dum-dum--dum-dum-dum---WHOOOOMPH--dum--dum-dum--dum-dum-dum---WHOOMPH. 
Anyways, the velocity and the motion are kinda
like you would get doing a mogul field, but a lot gentler and more regular.
And due to velocity, as you're going up each crest, you can be banking your
turn (into the "mogul"), and then right at the top you're completely neutral
and transitioning  your weight into the next turn. It's really quite an 
incredible feeling.

Shredding rules. If you can't shred at whatever
you're doing (or do not have the will to learn to shred) don't bother doing
it. So sick of people "going through the motions" in life... whether it
be relationships, their job/career/life, friendships, dancing, health, eating, 
whatever.

Geri? Do you shred?

--

Subject: [sfraves] [Politics-NRR]Time to stir the pot from the bottom this time

GEORGE W. BUSH RESUME 
The White House, USA 

* ACCOMPLISHMENTS AS PRESIDENT: 



* I attacked and took over two countries. 

* I spent the U.S. surplus and looted the U.S. Treasury. 

* I shattered the record for biggest annual deficit in history. 

* I set an economic record for most private bankruptcies filed in any
12- month period. 

* I set all-time record for biggest drop in the history of the stock
market. 

* I am the first president in decades to execute a federal prisoner. 

* I am the first president in US history to enter office with a criminal
record. 

* In my first year in office I set the all-time record for most days on
vacation by any president in US history. 

* After taking the entire month of August off for vacation, I presided
over the worst security failure in US history. 

* I set the record for most campaign fund raising trips by any president
in US history. 

* In my first two years in office over 2 million Americans lost their
job. 

* I cut unemployment benefits for more out-of-work Americans than any
other president in US history. 

* I set the all-time record for most foreclosures in a 12-month period. 

* I appointed more convicted criminals to administration positions than
any president in US history. 

* I set the record for the fewest press conferences of any president
since the advent of TV. 

* I signed more laws and executive orders amending the Constitution than
any other president in US history. 

* I presided over the biggest energy crises in US history and refused to
intervene when corruption was revealed. 

* I presided over the highest gasoline prices in US history and refused
to use the national reserves as past presidents have. 

* I cut health care benefits for war veterans. 

* I set the all-time record for most people worldwide to simultaneously
take to the streets to protest me (15 million people), shattering the
record for protest against any person in the history of mankind. 

* I dissolved more international treaties than any president in US
history. 

* I've made my presidency the most secretive and unaccountable of any in
US history. 

* Members of my cabinet are the richest of any administration in US
history. (The 'poorest' multimillionaire, Condoleezza Rice, has a
Chevron oil tanker named after her). 

* I am the first president in US history to have all 50 states of the
Union simultaneously go insolvent. 

* I presided over the biggest corporate stock market fraud in any market
in any country in the history of the world. 

* I am the first president in US history to order a US attack and
military occupation of a sovereign nation, and I did so against the will
of the United Nations and the world community. 

* I have created the largest government department bureaucracy in the
history of the United States. 

* I set the all-time record for biggest annual budget spending
increases, more than any other president in US history. 

* I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
remove the US from the Human Rights Commission. 

* I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
remove the US from the Elections Monitoring Board. 

* I removed more checks and balances, and have the least amount of
congressional oversight than any presidential administration in US
history. 

* I rendered the entire United Nations irrelevant. 

* I withdrew from the World Court of Law. 

* I refused to allow inspectors access to US prisoners of war and by
default no longer abide by the Geneva Conventions. 

* I am the first president in US history to refuse United Nations
election inspectors access during the 2002 US elections. 

* I am the all-time US (and world) record holder for most corporate
campaign donations. 

* The biggest lifetime contributor to my campaign, who is also one of my
best friends, presided over one of the largest corporate bankruptcy
frauds in world history (Kenneth Lay, former CEO of Enron Corporation).
I spent more money on polls and focus groups than any president in US
history. 

* I am the first president to run and hide when the US came under attack
(and then lied, saying the enemy had the code to Air Force 1) 

* I am the first US president to establish a secret shadow government. 

* I took the world's sympathy for the US after 911, and in less than a
year made the US the most resented country in the world (possibly the
biggest diplomatic failure in US and world history). 

* I am the first US president in history to have a majority of the
people of Europe (71%) view my presidency as the biggest threat to world
peace and stability. 

* I am the first US president in history to have the people of South
Korea more threatened by the US than by their immediate neighbor, North
Korea. 

* I changed US policy to allow convicted criminals to be awarded
government contracts. 

* I set the all-time record for number of administration appointees who
violated US law by not selling their huge investments in corporations
bidding for gov't contracts. 

* I have removed more freedoms and civil liberties for Americans than
any other president in US history. In a little over two years I have
created the most divided country in decades, possibly the most divided
that the US has been since the civil war. 

* I entered office with the strongest economy in US history and in less
than two years turned every single economic category heading straight
down. 




* RECORDS AND REFERENCES: 



* I have at least one conviction for drunk driving in Maine (Texas
driving record has been erased and is not available). 

* I was AWOL from the National Guard and deserted the military during a
time of war. I refuse to take a drug test or even answer any questions
about drug use. 

* All records of my tenure as governor of Texas have been spirited away
to my father's library, sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
view. 

* All records of any SEC investigations into my insider trading or
bankrupt companies are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
view. 

* All minutes of meetings of any public corporation for which I served
on the board are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view. 

* Any records or minutes from meetings I (or my VP) attended regarding
public energy policy are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
review. 




* PERSONAL REFERENCES: 



* For personal references, please speak to my dad or James Baker (They
can be reached in their offices at the Carlyle Group where they are
helping to divide up the spoils of the US-Iraq war and plan for the next
one.)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org


From sfraves-return-104330-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Jul 29 17:28:34 2003

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [Politics-NRR]Time to stir the pot from the bottom
 this time

Some fact checking would be nice....



On Tue, 29 Jul 2003, Jason wrote:

> GEORGE W. BUSH RESUME
> The White House, USA
>
> * ACCOMPLISHMENTS AS PRESIDENT:
>
>
>
> * I attacked and took over two countries.
>
> * I spent the U.S. surplus and looted the U.S. Treasury.
>
> * I shattered the record for biggest annual deficit in history.
>
> * I set an economic record for most private bankruptcies filed in any
> 12- month period.
>
> * I set all-time record for biggest drop in the history of the stock
> market.
>
> * I am the first president in decades to execute a federal prisoner.
>
> * I am the first president in US history to enter office with a criminal
> record.
>
> * In my first year in office I set the all-time record for most days on
> vacation by any president in US history.
>
> * After taking the entire month of August off for vacation, I presided
> over the worst security failure in US history.
>
> * I set the record for most campaign fund raising trips by any president
> in US history.
>
> * In my first two years in office over 2 million Americans lost their
> job.
>
> * I cut unemployment benefits for more out-of-work Americans than any
> other president in US history.
>
> * I set the all-time record for most foreclosures in a 12-month period.
>
> * I appointed more convicted criminals to administration positions than
> any president in US history.
>
> * I set the record for the fewest press conferences of any president
> since the advent of TV.
>
> * I signed more laws and executive orders amending the Constitution than
> any other president in US history.
>
> * I presided over the biggest energy crises in US history and refused to
> intervene when corruption was revealed.
>
> * I presided over the highest gasoline prices in US history and refused
> to use the national reserves as past presidents have.
>
> * I cut health care benefits for war veterans.
>
> * I set the all-time record for most people worldwide to simultaneously
> take to the streets to protest me (15 million people), shattering the
> record for protest against any person in the history of mankind.
>
> * I dissolved more international treaties than any president in US
> history.
>
> * I've made my presidency the most secretive and unaccountable of any in
> US history.
>
> * Members of my cabinet are the richest of any administration in US
> history. (The 'poorest' multimillionaire, Condoleezza Rice, has a
> Chevron oil tanker named after her).
>
> * I am the first president in US history to have all 50 states of the
> Union simultaneously go insolvent.
>
> * I presided over the biggest corporate stock market fraud in any market
> in any country in the history of the world.
>
> * I am the first president in US history to order a US attack and
> military occupation of a sovereign nation, and I did so against the will
> of the United Nations and the world community.
>
> * I have created the largest government department bureaucracy in the
> history of the United States.
>
> * I set the all-time record for biggest annual budget spending
> increases, more than any other president in US history.
>
> * I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
> remove the US from the Human Rights Commission.
>
> * I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
> remove the US from the Elections Monitoring Board.
>
> * I removed more checks and balances, and have the least amount of
> congressional oversight than any presidential administration in US
> history.
>
> * I rendered the entire United Nations irrelevant.
>
> * I withdrew from the World Court of Law.
>
> * I refused to allow inspectors access to US prisoners of war and by
> default no longer abide by the Geneva Conventions.
>
> * I am the first president in US history to refuse United Nations
> election inspectors access during the 2002 US elections.
>
> * I am the all-time US (and world) record holder for most corporate
> campaign donations.
>
> * The biggest lifetime contributor to my campaign, who is also one of my
> best friends, presided over one of the largest corporate bankruptcy
> frauds in world history (Kenneth Lay, former CEO of Enron Corporation).
> I spent more money on polls and focus groups than any president in US
> history.
>
> * I am the first president to run and hide when the US came under attack
> (and then lied, saying the enemy had the code to Air Force 1)
>
> * I am the first US president to establish a secret shadow government.
>
> * I took the world's sympathy for the US after 911, and in less than a
> year made the US the most resented country in the world (possibly the
> biggest diplomatic failure in US and world history).
>
> * I am the first US president in history to have a majority of the
> people of Europe (71%) view my presidency as the biggest threat to world
> peace and stability.
>
> * I am the first US president in history to have the people of South
> Korea more threatened by the US than by their immediate neighbor, North
> Korea.
>
> * I changed US policy to allow convicted criminals to be awarded
> government contracts.
>
> * I set the all-time record for number of administration appointees who
> violated US law by not selling their huge investments in corporations
> bidding for gov't contracts.
>
> * I have removed more freedoms and civil liberties for Americans than
> any other president in US history. In a little over two years I have
> created the most divided country in decades, possibly the most divided
> that the US has been since the civil war.
>
> * I entered office with the strongest economy in US history and in less
> than two years turned every single economic category heading straight
> down.
>
>
>
>
> * RECORDS AND REFERENCES:
>
>
>
> * I have at least one conviction for drunk driving in Maine (Texas
> driving record has been erased and is not available).
>
> * I was AWOL from the National Guard and deserted the military during a
> time of war. I refuse to take a drug test or even answer any questions
> about drug use.
>
> * All records of my tenure as governor of Texas have been spirited away
> to my father's library, sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> view.
>
> * All records of any SEC investigations into my insider trading or
> bankrupt companies are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> view.
>
> * All minutes of meetings of any public corporation for which I served
> on the board are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view.
>
> * Any records or minutes from meetings I (or my VP) attended regarding
> public energy policy are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> review.
>
>
>
>
> * PERSONAL REFERENCES:
>
>
>
> * For personal references, please speak to my dad or James Baker (They
> can be reached in their offices at the Carlyle Group where they are
> helping to divide up the spoils of the US-Iraq war and plan for the next
> one.)
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>

> > * I've made my presidency the most secretive and unaccountable of any
> in
> > US history.
> >
> > * Members of my cabinet are the richest of any administration in US
> > history. (The 'poorest' multimillionaire, Condoleezza Rice, has a
> > Chevron oil tanker named after her).
> >
> > * I am the first president in US history to have all 50 states of the
> > Union simultaneously go insolvent.
> >
> > * I presided over the biggest corporate stock market fraud in any
> market
> > in any country in the history of the world.
> >
> > * I am the first president in US history to order a US attack and
> > military occupation of a sovereign nation, and I did so against the
> will
> > of the United Nations and the world community.
> >
> > * I have created the largest government department bureaucracy in the
> > history of the United States.
> >
> > * I set the all-time record for biggest annual budget spending
> > increases, more than any other president in US history.
> >
> > * I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
> > remove the US from the Human Rights Commission.
> >
> > * I am the first president in US history to have the United Nations
> > remove the US from the Elections Monitoring Board.
> >
> > * I removed more checks and balances, and have the least amount of
> > congressional oversight than any presidential administration in US
> > history.
> >
> > * I rendered the entire United Nations irrelevant.
> >
> > * I withdrew from the World Court of Law.
> >
> > * I refused to allow inspectors access to US prisoners of war and by
> > default no longer abide by the Geneva Conventions.
> >
> > * I am the first president in US history to refuse United Nations
> > election inspectors access during the 2002 US elections.
> >
> > * I am the all-time US (and world) record holder for most corporate
> > campaign donations.
> >
> > * The biggest lifetime contributor to my campaign, who is also one of
> my
> > best friends, presided over one of the largest corporate bankruptcy
> > frauds in world history (Kenneth Lay, former CEO of Enron
> Corporation).
> > I spent more money on polls and focus groups than any president in US
> > history.
> >
> > * I am the first president to run and hide when the US came under
> attack
> > (and then lied, saying the enemy had the code to Air Force 1)
> >
> > * I am the first US president to establish a secret shadow government.
> >
> > * I took the world's sympathy for the US after 911, and in less than a
> > year made the US the most resented country in the world (possibly the
> > biggest diplomatic failure in US and world history).
> >
> > * I am the first US president in history to have a majority of the
> > people of Europe (71%) view my presidency as the biggest threat to
> world
> > peace and stability.
> >
> > * I am the first US president in history to have the people of South
> > Korea more threatened by the US than by their immediate neighbor,
> North
> > Korea.
> >
> > * I changed US policy to allow convicted criminals to be awarded
> > government contracts.
> >
> > * I set the all-time record for number of administration appointees
> who
> > violated US law by not selling their huge investments in corporations
> > bidding for gov't contracts.
> >
> > * I have removed more freedoms and civil liberties for Americans than
> > any other president in US history. In a little over two years I have
> > created the most divided country in decades, possibly the most divided
> > that the US has been since the civil war.
> >
> > * I entered office with the strongest economy in US history and in
> less
> > than two years turned every single economic category heading straight
> > down.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > * RECORDS AND REFERENCES:
> >
> >
> >
> > * I have at least one conviction for drunk driving in Maine (Texas
> > driving record has been erased and is not available).
> >
> > * I was AWOL from the National Guard and deserted the military during
> a
> > time of war. I refuse to take a drug test or even answer any questions
> > about drug use.
> >
> > * All records of my tenure as governor of Texas have been spirited
> away
> > to my father's library, sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> > view.
> >
> > * All records of any SEC investigations into my insider trading or
> > bankrupt companies are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> > view.
> >
> > * All minutes of meetings of any public corporation for which I served
> > on the board are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view.
> >
> > * Any records or minutes from meetings I (or my VP) attended regarding
> > public energy policy are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public
> > review.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > * PERSONAL REFERENCES:
> >
> >
> >
> > * For personal references, please speak to my dad or James Baker (They
> > can be reached in their offices at the Carlyle Group where they are
> > helping to divide up the spoils of the US-Iraq war and plan for the
> next
> > one.)

too tired to write a coherent review - so i will just summarize with =
some key points...

* Venue is very nice, clean, in a very nice neighborhood, lots of =
dancing room, some pool tables (6 i think), some arcade games, an =
outdoor smoking patio, and 2 bars (only 1 was open last night)
* Drinks are nice, strong, and cheap... even though all i had were the =
$2 long island ice teas; i figure the other drinks are PROBABLY good =
too...
* great concept of having open tables (30 minute slots).... and if you =
dont like whats playing, something else will be on within 30 minutes...
* location is central :: 30 - 45 minutes from San Jose, 10 - 15 minutes =
from Fremont, 15 - 20 minutes from SF, 10 - 15 minutes from Oakland / =
Berkeley...
* Drank too much on monday night - now i have a headache.... blah!

i hope that makes sense....


---
Timothy Penner

http://HardcoreForThePeople.com

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  teach kids to DJ

saw this on craigslist:

http://www.craigslist.org/eby/npo/13999650.html

Do you want to make good money doing what you love to do? DJing that is!

Community Learning Services (CLS), an education non-profit, is offering a
one week mini-course on "How to be a DJ" from August 4-8th from 4-6pm. We're 
looking for an instructor to teach the class. . .those who have worked with 
youth and/or taught before are preferred. The class will be held at Cafe 
Eclectica at 1309 Solano Ave, Albany and will have up to 10 students.

Here's the Course Description for Youth:
Who wants to be a DJ? You do! This class is designed for turntable
newcomers who want to learn the basics. You will learn firsthand how to
mix, blend, scratch, and beat juggle from Bay Area DJ’s. Turntables
provided for class.

If you like working with youth ages 14-18, love teaching how to DJ, and
can provide your own turntables/records/needles. . .this is the job for you.

If interested, send me an email (bfinnin@communitylearningservices.org) with 
your background and an outline of what you would teach.

Thanks,

Barb
www.communitylearningservices.org

> >> * I spent the U.S. surplus and looted the U.S. Treasury.

> the early 90's, came in and
>  cleaned out Russia and left the country broke and the people starving.
> ARE WE SEEING A REPEAT?

You're talking about "projected", not actual. Sorry, I haven't heard about
the neo-cons cleaning out Russia.


> * I shattered the record for biggest annual deficit in history.
>
>
>   350b tax releaf for the rich? Like I said, one year a 3t surpluss, one
> year -2t and growing deficit.
>   Schools and social services are being cut, people being laid off while
> CEO'S (Bush's REAL friends)                      are cutting themselves
> phat raises. HEY, WHERE'S THE PEOPLE'S MONEY GOING?

It's the biggest deficit in absolute terms, but not relative to the GDP.
So this point is technically correct, but misleading in its implication.


> >> * I set an economic record for most private bankruptcies filed in
> >any
> >> 12- month period.
>
>
>  Thanks to "free trade", we are becoming a poor nation. Jobs are going
> overseas, WHAT JOBS ARE
>  LEFT are $6p/h jobs with no health care and (coming soon) no overtime.
> There is a possibility we may
>  have a permanent 20-30% unemployed/underemployed rate in the US because
> of "free trade".
>  Neo-Cons (yes they are cons!) are cool with that. More unemployed means
> more eccess labor
>  "competing" for what few jobs there are, thus they can pay them what
> they want and treat them any way
>  they like. Good for THE BOTTOM LINE. 1870's here we come!!!!

Again, this is probably a record in absolute terms, but not as a
percentage. After all, there are more people now than ever before, so it
makes sense that the absolute number of bankruptcies will keep going up.
As for your point, why shouldn't people in poor countries have the chance
to compete with Americans for work? "There is a possibility", sure, but
not a reasonable one.


> >> * I set all-time record for biggest drop in the history of the
> >stock
> >> market.
>
>
>  People saw the stock market as a legal scam and pulled their money.
> After the MCI/Enron
>  scandal (WHO HAS GONE TO JAIL YET?), who's to blame them? There is no
> difference between
>  the Stock Exchange and Las Vegas. Both are speculative, both are based
> on greed, and both are
>  hopelessly corrupt and ridged to steal from the common players.

The stock market dropped because there was a huge bubble built up during
the Clinton administration! It's still overvalued by most historical

so-and-so is a bad dictator and the people are protesting against him
and we're helping them.  How is this different than israel and palestine
though?  Oh yeah, because israel is our friends and palestine is just a
rogue nation of people pushed out of their homes a while back and for
some reason are pissed off about it.  And what about the south american
coup of the week?  Why does the media only pick one hotspot at a time.
And whatever happened to North Korea?  Did they just crawl back into a
hole?  I haven't heard anything about how relations are going with them
now..  And india and china blaming each other for running missions into
the others countries.  And India and Pakistan always at it of coruse.
And possible fighting between Thailand and Cambodia.. Or was it Laos...
Its just too much to handle.  Nothing anyone does to help helps, it just
seems to fan the flames while being swept under the rug.  We're tired of
it all.  Its hard to pick something to protest or talk about when we
have too much to choose from.. Which one is the worse of worses.
Although I think in Libya we're helping an already mounting body count
in a country were agressions are flying high and the people won't take
it anymore.  They want help, but they were willing to start without us.
I have no idea where I'm going with this.  I'm tired.  War sucks.

At 04:00 PM 7/29/2003 -0700, Cheese wrote:

>so regardless of the support from other countries; all those "pro-life" and
>"anti-war" people are for some strange reason, "ok with this war"?
>interesting how some people will just drop their morals because something is
>"widely accepted".


I don't think most of the thoughtful people on this list develop their 
beliefs about war based on popular opinion, as you seem to suggest.  There 
are some who are pacifists and, therefore, are against all use of deadly 
force on moral grounds.  Others, and I include myself here, would support a 
defensive war like WWII while opposing a pre-emptive war like that waged in 
Iraq.  As for Liberia, I believe the United Nations should take action in 
concert with other nations to end the slaughter there.  'Tis all not black 
'n white.

Love,

Apollo

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Thought for Today

--=====================_9294964==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

In ancient Greece, Socrates was reputed to hold knowledge in high
esteem.

One day an acquaintance met the great philosopher and said, "Socrates,
do you know what I just heard about your best friend?"

"Hold on a minute," Socrates replied. "Before telling me anything, I'd like
you to pass a little test.  It's called the Triple Filter Test."

"Triple filter?"

"That's right," Socrates continued.  "Before you talk to me about my 
friend, it might be a good idea to take a moment and filter what you're 
going to say.
The first filter is Truth.  Have you made absolutely sure that what you are 
about to tell me is true?"

"No," the man said, "actually I just heard about it and................"

"All right," said Socrates.  "So, you don't really know if it's true or not.
Now let's try the second filter, the filter of Goodness.  Is what you are 
about to tell me about my friend something good?"

 > > >"No, on the contrary.........."

"So," Socrates continued, "you want to tell me something bad about him,but 
you're not certain it's true.
You may still pass the test though, because there's one filter left:the 
filter of Usefulness.
  Is what you want to tell me about my friend going to be useful to me?"

"No, not really."

"Well," concluded Socrates, "if what you want to tell me is neither
true nor good, nor even useful, why tell it to me at all?"


This is why Socrates was a great philosopher and held in such high esteem.
It also explains why he never found out his best friend was banging his wife.


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

bestfriend banging their wife would be classified as useless information. if
my bestfriend was banging my wife; i sure as hell would not classify that

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, July 29, 2003 6:28 PM
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Thought for Today


> In ancient Greece, Socrates was reputed to hold knowledge in high
> esteem.
>
> One day an acquaintance met the great philosopher and said, "Socrates,
> do you know what I just heard about your best friend?"
>
> "Hold on a minute," Socrates replied. "Before telling me anything, I'd
like
> you to pass a little test.  It's called the Triple Filter Test."
>
> "Triple filter?"
>
> "That's right," Socrates continued.  "Before you talk to me about my
> friend, it might be a good idea to take a moment and filter what you're
> going to say.
> The first filter is Truth.  Have you made absolutely sure that what you
are
> about to tell me is true?"
>
> "No," the man said, "actually I just heard about it and................"
>
> "All right," said Socrates.  "So, you don't really know if it's true or
not.
> Now let's try the second filter, the filter of Goodness.  Is what you are
> about to tell me about my friend something good?"
>
>  > > >"No, on the contrary.........."
>
> "So," Socrates continued, "you want to tell me something bad about him,but
> you're not certain it's true.
> You may still pass the test though, because there's one filter left:the
> filter of Usefulness.
>   Is what you want to tell me about my friend going to be useful to me?"
>
> "No, not really."
>
> "Well," concluded Socrates, "if what you want to tell me is neither
> true nor good, nor even useful, why tell it to me at all?"
>
>
> This is why Socrates was a great philosopher and held in such high esteem.
> It also explains why he never found out his best friend was banging his
wife.
>
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
> "Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do
> the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
> safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring
> adventure or nothing."
> -Helen Keller
>
> "Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.
It's
> a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well
can
> we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when
we
> recognize our shared humanity."
> -Pema Chodron
>
> "It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
> -Dizzy Gillespie
>

From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>

> In ancient Greece, Socrates was reputed to hold knowledge in high 
> esteem.
>
> One day an acquaintance met the great philosopher and said, "Socrates,

> do you know what I just heard about your best friend?"
>
> "Hold on a minute," Socrates replied. "Before telling me anything, I'd
like
> you to pass a little test.  It's called the Triple Filter Test."
>
> "Triple filter?"
>
> "That's right," Socrates continued.  "Before you talk to me about my 
> friend, it might be a good idea to take a moment and filter what 
> you're going to say. The first filter is Truth.  Have you made 
> absolutely sure that what you
are
> about to tell me is true?"
>
> "No," the man said, "actually I just heard about it 
> and................"
>
> "All right," said Socrates.  "So, you don't really know if it's true 
> or
not.
> Now let's try the second filter, the filter of Goodness.  Is what you 
> are about to tell me about my friend something good?"
>
>  > > >"No, on the contrary.........."
>
> "So," Socrates continued, "you want to tell me something bad about 
> him,but you're not certain it's true. You may still pass the test 
> though, because there's one filter left:the filter of Usefulness.
>   Is what you want to tell me about my friend going to be useful to
me?"
>
> "No, not really."
>
> "Well," concluded Socrates, "if what you want to tell me is neither 
> true nor good, nor even useful, why tell it to me at all?"
>
>
> This is why Socrates was a great philosopher and held in such high 
> esteem. It also explains why he never found out his best friend was 
> banging his
wife.
>

> http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

> do the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger 
> is no safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a 
> daring adventure or nothing." -Helen Keller

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Mime-version: 1.0
Content-type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Thought for Today

No Cheese -- the example isn't flawed at all... Remember the first part of
the filter; *Truth* -- The man who came to Socrates did not know that it was
true that Socrates friend was sleeping with his wife -- it was only hearsay,
a rumor. If he had known it to be certain then it would've passed the first
of the three filters. An unsubstantiated rumor of infidelity is not liable
to be beneficial as it will lead Socrates to question the trust that he has
instilled in both his friend and his wife, when in fact it could simply be
slanderous gossip. Furthermore, of what use is it to Socrates to know that
someone out there thinks that his bestfriend is sleeping with his wife?
Sure, now he can call them on it, but we both know they'd just deny it. He
can become suspicious and try to catch them in the act but that means that
he's abandoned the trust that he placed in his bestfriend and his spouse and
doing so based on nothing more than a rumor is not only unwise but also sure
to be damaging to both his relationship with his friend and his wife.
Furthermore, assuming that the rumor was not true, then the man who
approached Socrates could've been responsible for ruining not one but two
important relationships in Socrates life. Is that useful? No.

Great piece of wisdom Apollo, and even with the joke thrown in -- it still
stands up. Namaste.

>> we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when
> we
>> recognize our shared humanity."
>> -Pema Chodron
>> 
>> "It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
>> -Dizzy Gillespie
>> 
>> U

votes of the people don't matter in this country anymore.  So what's the point?

up by the government's uniformed thugs for having the "wrong" politicial

of DARK ELEKTRONIKA

Jawa, Phreaki Boi, & RMS

WHEN: August 5th (and every 1st Tuesday) 9PM-2AM

WHERE: 26Mix: 3024 Mission Street (at 26th) in San Francisco
There are several MUNI lines that are within a couple block radius (14 
& 49 go right by!) and BART is 2 blocks away. See our web site for more 
in depth public transportation info and maps.

HOW: FREE before 10:30 and only $3 after.

ANYTHING ELSE?: This is a great venue with pool tables, pinball, and 
classic video games!
$1 customer abuse shots (mystery shots) & $1 Pabst Blue Ribbons all 
night long!
Happy Hour ends at nine, so if you come a little early you can get $2 
well, draft & domestic bottles
Free lockers on a first come, first served basis.  Obtain key from 
bartender or bring your own lock.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [Politics-NRR]Time to stir the pot from the bottom this time

I'm a member of the armed forces already and no I don't want to
reinstitute the draft.  It waters down the professional soldiers we have
with unworthy talent.  

I've spent most of my adult life in countries where they "hate" us.  You
can always find someone in those countries that like you (korea,
germany).  

We aren't bogged down in iraq.  I hope you aren't saying that you listen
to the liberal media shouting QUAGMIRE!  Because it isn't like that at
all.  America is rebuilding that country and doing so faster than is
being reported by the idiots at CNN and the BBC.

The war on terror is going to be pennies on the dollar compared to
ignoring the problem like Clinton did.  I will not vote for anyone that
wants to be soft on terror.  Ever.  I wish I could take by my votes for
Clinton because he cause the problems that we are seeing today.  Because
of his inaction, we are seeing nuclear proliferation problems and a
growing terrorist threat.  The only way to stop these issues is to carry
a big stick and not be afraid to whack people with it.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [Politics-NRR]Time to stir the pot from the bottom this time

I just wanna know when the war on terror is going to turn inward.
Stopping our current terrorist organizations like street gangs,
anti-government milita groups that do incite violence (militia groups
are a constitutional right), violent aryan groups (free speech until
they turn violent), violent christian groups that blow up abortion
clinics, and violent envionmental groups.  It's only a matter of time
before someone with a lot of intelligence in one of these groups is able
to put together a nuke as well.  It can be done without a lot of
equipment, minus the uranium.  We have plenty of terrorists inside our
borders that need to be delt with on the same level we deal with groups
like Hamas and Al-Qaeda.  I see no difference with some guy walking into
a caf=E9 in israel and blowing himself up and a carfull of thugs in
Oakland shooting up a neighborhood and taking down innocents in
crossfire.  Here's some old material but a survey of 45 cities, reported
that there were around 1500 street gangs with as many as 120,000 members
between them.  That=92s a pretty damn big army of terrorists spread =
across
45 cities.
http://www.usdoj.gov/usao/eousa/foia_reading_room/usam/title9/crm00103.h

I'm a member of the armed forces already and no I don't want to
reinstitute the draft.  It waters down the professional soldiers we have
with unworthy talent. =20

I've spent most of my adult life in countries where they "hate" us.  You
can always find someone in those countries that like you (korea,
germany). =20

We aren't bogged down in iraq.  I hope you aren't saying that you listen
to the liberal media shouting QUAGMIRE!  Because it isn't like that at
all.  America is rebuilding that country and doing so faster than is
being reported by the idiots at CNN and the BBC.

The war on terror is going to be pennies on the dollar compared to
ignoring the problem like Clinton did.  I will not vote for anyone that
wants to be soft on terror.  Ever.  I wish I could take by my votes for
Clinton because he cause the problems that we are seeing today.  Because
of his inaction, we are seeing nuclear proliferation problems and a
growing terrorist threat.  The only way to stop these issues is to carry
a big stick and not be afraid to whack people with it. =20

equipment, minus the uranium.  We have plenty of terrorists inside our
borders that need to be delt with on the same level we deal with groups
like Hamas and Al-Qaeda.  I see no difference with some guy walking into
a caf=E9 in israel and blowing himself up and a carfull of thugs in
Oakland shooting up a neighborhood and taking down innocents in
crossfire.  Here's some old material but a survey of 45 cities, reported
that there were around 1500 street gangs with as many as 120,000 members
between them.  That=92s a pretty damn big army of terrorists spread =
across

all.  America is rebuilding that country and doing so faster than is
being reported by the idiots at CNN and the BBC.

The war on terror is going to be pennies on the dollar compared to
ignoring the problem like Clinton did.  I will not vote for anyone that
wants to be soft on terror.  Ever.  I wish I could take by my votes for
Clinton because he cause the problems that we are seeing today.  Because
of his inaction, we are seeing nuclear proliferation problems and a
growing terrorist threat.  The only way to stop these issues is to carry
a big stick and not be afraid to whack people with it.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



****************PLEASE DO NOT POST TO OTHER LISTS*****************



SATURDAY, AUGUST 2nd

10PM to 6AM

MOKSHA TRIBE
presents

**JAGAN**
(the third eye)

9e2581.jpg

Hiei is a fire apparition whose true origins are unknown. He is a master 
swordsman, and his strength and speed are incredible. However, these are 
hardly his most fearsome abilities. Typically kept concealed behind a 
bandanna on his forehead is the "Jagan," a mysterious third eye that 
possesses magical properties.

Moksha Tribe celebrates Japanese anime, culture and JAGAN -- the Chakra of 
psychic perception that can overcome the demons of oppression.  You are 
invited to dress as your favorite anime character or in traditional 
Japanese attire.  Three full rooms of rockin' house, breaks, tech-trance, 
drum 'n' bass, psytrance, ambient and experimental beats at a convenient 
underground Bay Area location.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

IZOU (Legacy) Room (in order of appearance):

Marcine (Moksha Tribe)
DV 8 (Moksha Tribe/Evolving Spectrum Productions)
Andrew Phelan (Olive Records)
DilemaFunk Doc (Moshka Tribe)
Shawn Allen (Moksha Tribe)

TENTOU (Destiny) Room:

Phaedrus (Moksha Tribe)
Apollo (Moksha Tribe)
Les Elemental (Eden/ Pangea...NY/SF)
Drag'nfly (Epiphany)
Shez Tek (Moksha Tribe/Evolving Spectrum Productions)

SOUGOU (Synthesis) Room:

Andy TieDye (Moksha Tribe)
Cubik y Origami  Live PA (Moksha Tribe/newstylesound)
Red Stickman (Moksha Tribe/Ambient Mafia)
Boomerang Fidget (Ambient Mafia)
Howlin' Bob (Moksha Tribe)

Visuals by Viberation
Sound by Marshall Neuroscience Creations
Exhibition of "third eye" art works by Sarah Schumm

As always, you will be treated with love and respect and offered:

Free Water
Free Fruit
Free Refreshments
Free Toys and games
Free Coffee

Massages by Ravin Riz to benefit Larkin Street

ALL PROFITS FROM THIS EVENT WILL BE DONATED TO THE LARKIN STREET YOUTH CENTER
(http://www.larkinstreetyouth.org/)

Limited to 350 presale tickets,
available for $10 through Moksha Tribe members.  18+.

Tickets may also be purchased through PayPal for $11 to cover transaction 
costs.  To purchase now through PayPal go to:

http://mokshatribe.net/jagan/

All tickets sold by PayPal will be held at will call.
These sales are subject to availability.  The cut-off for all PayPal sales
is Friday, August 1st at 6:00 PM.

In addition, tickets may be purchased from Moksha Tribe collective members 
at parties
and other events, or you can contact the members below to arrange for
tickets:


South Bay:
Carl (nomadic@nomadicDJ.com)

East Bay:
Zack  (fuzzzone@hotmail.com)
Jessica (ceridwen_raud@yahoo.com)

Oakland:
Audra (drkstar927@hotmail.com)

San Francisco, Ocean Beach:
Apollo (apollo@speakeasy.org)

San Francisco, Castro area:
Tom (sheztek@yahoo.com)

Treasure Island, SF
Shelley (scarpetta80@yahoo.com)

For additional information and updates visit:

http://mokshatribe.net/jagan/



Love,

Moksha Tribe

(Liberation through music and dance)

Back when the whole war on terror thing started I posted about domestic
terror and most people immediately turned it back to outside threats...
*shrug*  Like they mean more than inside threats.  Terror is terror.
Someone walking down the street in the middle of the night shouldn't be
scared.  I've always been more scared of internal threats than external
since all my life growing up I've been pushed around by thugs in
Sacramento and Salt Lake (mostly the violent straight edgers that
travelled in groups of 20 or more).  Thrown through display racks in
stores, some dude even went donkey kong and was hucking huge garbage
cans at me in a park.  I did cross country all while growing up so I
could get away.   =20

Here's the current on Oaktown.
http://www.redding.com/news/state/past/20021117state030.shtml

Yet we keep making cuts on education.  We keep trampling the ability for
people to get good education and be productive.  And I'm not saying
everyone has to be a corporate slave.  No one seems to be learning the
age old value of earning your money now and wants a quick return over a
long investment.

>everyone has to be a corporate slave.  No one seems to be learning the
>age old value of earning your money now and wants a quick return over a
>long investment.

Yes....education, health, infrastructure -- all going to hell.  I heard a 
horrific estimate of true unemployment figures yesterday, and one segment 
of the data indicated that nearly sixty percent of inner city blacks were 
unemployed.  Couple this with the fact that many of these people end up in 
prison and become, in effect, unemployable long term and you create 
problems, including crime and violence, that will continue well into the 
future.

Love,

Apollo

From sfraves-return-104424-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed Jul 30 20:49:55 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-104424-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 62640 invoked by uid 1103); 30 Jul 2003 20:49:55 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 62626 invoked from network); 30 Jul 2003 20:49:55 -0000
Date: Wed, 30 Jul 2003 16:49:48 -0400
From: JonnyR@aol.com
To: SFRaves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Message-ID: <45014DEC.78E79F66.0004D974@aol.com>
X-Mailer: Atlas Mailer 2.0
X-AOL-IP: 168.103.98.161
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP-related: clarification, $9 Rendezvous tickets

Hi, the Istyly crew asked me to clarify the price for Rendezvous tickets. Apparently some people have gone to buy tickets and found that they would be $10 instead of $9. That's because the store selling the tickets added a $1 service charge, which is typical. Often, stores will charge $2 if it's a more expensive party. 

I used to own a store that sold party tickets. The service charge is the only money that stores make from ticket sales, but that's ok because people might buy records and other things while they're at your store to buy tickets. 

If you're far from a store and buy your tickets online, that's likely to cost a few dollars or more, but compared to driving 100 miles just to buy a ticket, that's not too bad. 

Note: if you're going to a massive, and there are tickets at Ticketmaster (and therefore Tower Records, etc) you're still better off getting your tickets at a store like Skills, F8, Solid Grooves, etc. I think I paid at least $8 in service charges when I bought a ticket for a massive at Ticketmaster, using a credit card. (But also keep in mind when you're buying tickets at a store like Skills: it's likely to be cash only. That's why it's so great they have an ATM right in the store!)

Tickets at the door will be $15.

And now, again, the info about Rendezvous:

Saturday, Aug. 2
Banging the Bass in ROOM ONE : Tom Slick, Mystre,  Thee-o,  Denise,  Ton:e,  Molly Mush,  Peter Gozenya vs Yagi,  & Lip. Bringing the Beats in ROOM TWO:   Torque,  EJthaDJ,  Little Star,  DJ Citrik,  Charlie,  Dj Girlie, & Carlos Alfonso. 6 pm to 2 am in San Leandro. All responsible ages are welcome to join our happy celebration. Infoline 415.820.1649 / 510.496.6065.

Yes....education, health, infrastructure -- all going to hell.  I heard
a
horrific estimate of true unemployment figures yesterday, and one
segment
of the data indicated that nearly sixty percent of inner city blacks
were
unemployed.  Couple this with the fact that many of these people end up
in
prison and become, in effect, unemployable long term and you create
problems, including crime and violence, that will continue well into the

future.

Love,

Apollo

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring

It's
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well
can

we
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Subject: [sfraves] sometimes sensitive to other's needs nrr

--0-1751431271-1059601926=:39972
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

occasionally, i will give something some thought and be sort of sensitive. sometimes, i don't have to think about it at all. i can always empathize, but also, in most cases, i won't be doing anything to make anything anything more or less than it is. hopefully, no one has been crying or sobbing or anything like that. it is okay to totally sob, but please, don't sob over me, because you never know if i will be sensitive or not, and usually, i am not by choice. most people aren't either. sometimes, i am just too busy trying to get my food despite much opposition. it is not always blatant insensitivity. :)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [Politics-NRR]Time to stir the pot from the   bottom this time

I'm sorry but a statistic like that, from multiple "credible" sources is
statistically
impossible; pun intended lol.  The unemployment rate for blacks in the
inner-city
is higher, certainly more than 10% but likely less than 20% with an unlikely
possibility
of 25% or so, and that would be a stretch.   Did you see the report (true
i'm sure heh)
recently that blamed telephone poles in the inner city for a lack of
self-esteem?  Just
saying that it's hard to believe far out stats and research ;)

At 03:04 PM 7/30/2003 -0700, micromu wrote:

>I'm sorry but a statistic like that, from multiple "credible" sources is
>statistically
>impossible; pun intended lol.  The unemployment rate for blacks in the
>inner-city
>is higher, certainly more than 10% but likely less than 20% with an unlikely
>possibility
>of 25% or so, and that would be a stretch.   Did you see the report (true
>i'm sure heh)
>recently that blamed telephone poles in the inner city for a lack of
>self-esteem?  Just
>saying that it's hard to believe far out stats and research ;)


Where are your sources?  One thing I've discovered about data -- everyone 
has a different story.  Current unemployment stats, I think we all agree, 
don't accurately reflect those who have given up looking for work and those 
who never have been employed, especially teens and young adults.

But I have work to do....

Love,

Apollo

>To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
>For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U  
--=====================_9011428==.ALT--

On Wednesday, July 30, 2003, at 04:17 PM, Joeandus@aol.com wrote:

> Question: How many of you think we should be "recalling" the President
> instead of the Gov. for the state of the economy and global relations? 
> Mel

Recall? Impeachment? Calls for resignation? Screw that. What we've 
sorely needed for a long time is a revolution.

"god forbid we should ever be 20  years without such a rebellion. the 
people cannot be all, & always, well informed. the past which is wrong 
will be discontented  in proportion to the importance of the facts they 
misconceive; if they remain quiet under such misconceptions it is a 
lethargy, the forerunner of death to the public liberty. we have had 
13. states independant 11. years. there has been one rebellion. that 
comes to one rebellion in a century & a half for each state. what 
country before ever existed a century & half without a rebellion? & 
what country can preserve it's liberties if their rulers are not warned 
from time to time that their people preserve the spirit of resistance? 
let them take arms. the remedy  is to set them right as to facts, 
pardon & pacify them. what signify a few lives lost in a century or 
two? the tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the 
blood of patriots  & tyrants. it is it's natural manure."

   - Thomas Jefferson

http://www.loc.gov/exhibits/jefferson/105.html
--Apple-Mail-8--303789031--

I agree wholeheartedly, but the thing is, there's no
recall, and for that matter, no referendum power on
the federal level. Furthermore, there is no direct
political redress of the federal government at all!
Even the vote is mediated by the electoral college!
Ugh... I should have paid less attention in
government...it would have kept me happier and
ignorant longer. :b

The only immediate thing to do is impeach, and
remembering Clinton, we all know how that went down.
Furthermore, with a Republican Congress, there is no
way Senate will impeach let alone the House convict
Shrub. Sux. So the best thing is start working for
your favorite candidates in the local and state
elections for the next round.  

What's worse, is the argument that the republicans are
concerned about the budget, bull****. If they were
they would not be risking the 30 million it's costing
our counties to hold this unecessary election. And
what's more, when Davis wins (not if ya'll), the State
will owe him for his fees(i.e. the cost of running
against the election. You all know that Shrub is the
only president to simulatneously have all of the
states go insolvent? Perhaps another 40 mil will help
the budget eh? Put that in your pipe and smoke it. 

This is all about Tom Delay's and Daryl Issa's move to
carry out Shrub's plan to punish the states that
didn't go his way. 

Sorry about the diatribe...but I think I needed the
Catharsis

"the sixteen words"; they have absolutely nothing else to talk about.
Don't listen or read the "news" to make investment decisions. Corporate
profits for Q1 were REVISED UP by $20.1 billion; profits mean dividends.
That revision has also dispelled the rumor that we were in a recession.
We weren't.

If you've been watching the bond market, you'd know that the rise in the
bond market is a signal that the need for private money is higher now
and has signaled a return to corporations need for money to finance
projects.

popularity contest.  Sometimes being in charge means you have to piss
people off.  And make no mistake, America is in charge.  We will be
damned if we do, and damned if we don't.
